analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyu ni ji ltar med pa de ltar bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained how the cause of form does not exist.

original: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu'i gzugs rgyu med pa ga la yod /
analyzed: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu'i gzugs rgyu med pa ga la yod /
translated: If there is no cause, how can there be a result, form, without a cause?

original: mi rung rung min nyid ces bya ba nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i dgag pa gnyis po 'dis ni rgyu med par smra ba po shin tu tha chad yin par ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: mi rung rung min nyid ces bya ba nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i dgag pa gnyis po 'dis ni rgyu med par smra ba po shin tu tha chad yin par ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The two negations in the phrase ‚Äúnot tenable. Not tenable‚Äù indicate that the proponent of causelessness is utterly contemptible.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar gzugs rnam par dpyad pa na rnam pa thams cad du med pa de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid gzigs pas /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs rnam par dpyad pa na rnam pa thams cad du med pa de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid gzigs pas /
translated: Thus, when form is analyzed, it does not exist in any way. Therefore, the yogi/nƒ´ who sees reality

original: gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa ni //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa ni //
translated: should not conceive of form

original: 'ga' yang rnam par brtag mi bya //
analyzed: 'ga' yang rnam par brtag mi bya //
translated: in any way whatsoever.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzugs la dmigs pa 'ga' yang brtag par mi 'os so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzugs la dmigs pa 'ga' yang brtag par mi 'os so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not appropriate to investigate any conceptualization that focuses on form, such as form is impeded or unimpeded, demonstrable or not demonstrable, past or future, blue, yellow, and so on.

original: gzhan yang 'di gzugs kyi rgyur 'dod pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di gzugs kyi rgyur 'dod pa na /
translated: Moreover, if you assert that it is the cause of form,

original: 'bras bu 'dra ba 'am mi 'dra ba zhig sgrub par byed grang /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dra ba 'am mi 'dra ba zhig sgrub par byed grang /
translated: is it the cause of a similar or dissimilar effect?üîΩBoth are untenable.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa /
translated: It is untenable to state

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhes /üîΩbya ba 'thad pa ma yin te //üîΩ'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra zhes //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhes / bya ba 'thad pa ma yin te // 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra zhes //
translated: that the effect is similar to the cause.üîΩIt is also untenable to state

original: @42b bya ba'ang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @42b bya ba'ang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: that the effect is dissimilar to the cause.

original: de la gzugs kyi rgyu ni sra ba dang gsher ba dang dro ba dang g-yo ba'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi rgyu ni sra ba dang gsher ba dang dro ba dang g-yo ba'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: The cause of form is the essence of solidity, fluidity, heat, and movement.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa nang gi bdag nyid mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid can yin zhing /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa nang gi bdag nyid mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid can yin zhing /
translated: The internal sense sources that are derived from the elements, such as the eyes, are the support of the eye consciousness and so on, and they have the nature of clear form.

original: phyi rol gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas gzung bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid can yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas gzung bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid can yin gyi /
translated: The external sense sources, such as form, are characterized as the objects of the eye consciousness and so on.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid can tha dad pas mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis la 'dra ba nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid can tha dad pas mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis la 'dra ba nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But they are not by nature the great elements. Therefore, because the characteristics of the cause and effect are different, like nirvana, they are not similar.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to say that the effect resembles the cause.

original: s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa 'dra bar gyur pa rnams la phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma mthong ste /
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon la sogs pa 'dra bar gyur pa rnams la phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma mthong ste /
translated: Since rice seeds and so on that are similar are not seen to be mutually cause and effect,

original: 'di'i phyir yang /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang /
translated: therefore

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not tenable to say that the effect resembles the cause.

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not tenable to say that the effect is not similar to the cause.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because they have different characteristics, like nirvana.üîΩJust as form is not tenable in any way when analyzed in this way, so too feeling and so on are also like this.

original: ji ltar gzugs 'di rnam par dpyad pa na rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa yang yin no zhes bya bar bsgre ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs 'di rnam par dpyad pa na rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa yang yin no zhes bya bar bsgre ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:üîΩFeeling, discernment, formation,

original: tshor dang 'du shes 'du byed dang // sems dang dngos po thams cad kyang //
analyzed: tshor dang 'du shes 'du byed dang // sems dang dngos po thams cad kyang //
translated: And mind, and all things,

original: rnam pa dag ni thams cad du //
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni thams cad du //
translated: In every way,

original: gzugs nyid kyi ni rim pa mtshungs //
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyi ni rim pa mtshungs //
translated: Are just like form.

original: tshor ba la sogs thams cad kyang gzugs rnam par dpyad pa dang mtshungs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs thams cad kyang gzugs rnam par dpyad pa dang mtshungs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Feeling and so on should be applied in the same way as the analysis of form.

original: dbu ma pas ni ji ltar chos gcig stong pa nyid du bstan par 'dod pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu ma pas ni ji ltar chos gcig stong pa nyid du bstan par 'dod pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The Followers of the Middle Way, when teaching the emptiness of one phenomenon, can use the same approach to teach the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid kyis brtsad byas tshe //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis brtsad byas tshe //
translated: When one is refuted through emptiness,

original: gang zhig lan 'debs smra byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig lan 'debs smra byed pa //
translated: whatever answer one might give

original: de yi thams cad lan btab min //
analyzed: de yi thams cad lan btab min //
translated: will not be an answer at all,

original: bsgrub par bya dang mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya dang mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: for it will be equivalent to what is to be proven.

original: de la brtsad pa ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de la brtsad pa ni gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: Refutation is the refutation of the position of another.

original: stong pa nyid rgyur gyur pas gzugs rang bzhin med do zhes bya bas de ltar rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba bkag pa na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rgyur gyur pas gzugs rang bzhin med do zhes bya bas de ltar rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba bkag pa na /
translated: When one refutes the position that form is essenceless because of emptiness,

original: gal te gzhan lan du tshor ba la sogs pa ni re zhig yod la /
analyzed: gal te gzhan lan du tshor ba la sogs pa ni re zhig yod la /
translated: if one says that feeling and so forth exist,

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyang yod do zhes smra na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyang yod do zhes smra na /
translated: and that therefore form also exists,

original: de'i de lta bu de thams cad ni lan btab pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i de lta bu de thams cad ni lan btab pa ma yin te /
translated: then all of that is not an answer at all.

original: gang gi phyir tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yod @43a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yod @43a * //
translated: For the existence of feeling and so forth

original: pa yang bsgrub bya gzugs kyi yod pa dang mtshungs par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: pa yang bsgrub bya gzugs kyi yod pa dang mtshungs par rigs par bya'o //
translated: should be understood to be equivalent to the existence of form, which is to be proven.

original: ji ltar gzugs ni rang gi rgyu las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par dpyad pa na med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs ni rang gi rgyu las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par dpyad pa na med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as form does not exist in terms of identity or difference from its cause when it is investigated,

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'du shes dang / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yang /üîΩreg pa la sogs pa rang gi rgyu las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par dpyad na /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'du shes dang / ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa yang / reg pa la sogs pa rang gi rgyu las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rnam par dpyad na /
translated: so also feeling, which has contact as its condition, and perception, which arises together with consciousness, and formations, which have ignorance as their condition, and consciousness, which has formations as its condition,üîΩdo not exist in terms of identity or difference from their causes when they are investigated.

original: yod pa ma yin pas 'di dag thams cad bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pas 'di dag thams cad bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all of these are the same as the probandum.

original: ji ltar tshor ba la sogs pa dag bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang / mtshan gzhi dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyang bsgrub par bya ba gzugs dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba la sogs pa dag bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang / mtshan gzhi dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / yan lag dang yan lag can la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyang bsgrub par bya ba gzugs dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Just as feeling and so on are the same as the probandum, so also all things, such as characteristics and the basis of characteristics, cause and effect, parts and wholes, and so on, are the same as the probandum, form.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis lan gdab pa lta yod par ga la 'gyur te 'di'i tshig thams cad bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis lan gdab pa lta yod par ga la 'gyur te 'di'i tshig thams cad bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, how could there be any reply by another? All of his words would be the same as the proposition.

original: bstan bcos su smras pa'i lan thams cad la dbu ma pas bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa nyid brjod par bya'o zhes slob dpon slob par mdzad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos su smras pa'i lan thams cad la dbu ma pas bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa nyid brjod par bya'o zhes slob dpon slob par mdzad do //
translated: The master teaches that the Centrist should state that all the replies given in the treatise are the same as the proposition.üîΩJust as this method is stated in the refutation of the position of another, so it is also when one is the expounder.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa la tshul 'di brjod pa de bzhin du bshad pa byed pa'i tshe na yang yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa la tshul 'di brjod pa de bzhin du bshad pa byed pa'i tshe na yang yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: stong pa nyid kyis bshad byas tshe //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis bshad byas tshe //
translated: When emptiness is explained,

original: gang zhig skyon 'dogs smra byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig skyon 'dogs smra byed pa //
translated: Whatever is stated as an objection

original: de yis thams cad skyon btags min //
analyzed: de yis thams cad skyon btags min //
translated: By that, all is not objected to,

original: bsgrub par bya dang mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya dang mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: For it is the same as the proposition.

original: bshad pa byed pa'i dus su yang slob ma lta bu gang zhig rgol bar byed pa de'i tshe brgal ba de yang snga ma bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa byed pa'i dus su yang slob ma lta bu gang zhig rgol bar byed pa de'i tshe brgal ba de yang snga ma bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: And when it is time to explain, if a student or someone else objects, then that objection should be understood to be just like the one that was refuted earlier.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dngos po gcig gi lta po gang //
analyzed: dngos po gcig gi lta po gang //
translated: Whoever sees one thing

original: de ni kun gyi lta por brjod //
analyzed: de ni kun gyi lta por brjod //
translated: Is said to see all things.

original: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //
analyzed: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //
translated: The emptiness of one thing

original: de ni kun gyi stong pa nyid //üîΩces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni kun gyi stong pa nyid // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Is the emptiness of all.

original: 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi mdo las kyang //üîΩchos gcig gis ni chos rnams thams cad sgyu ma dang // smig rgyu dang 'dra gzung byar med cing gsog dang ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi mdo las kyang // chos gcig gis ni chos rnams thams cad sgyu ma dang // smig rgyu dang 'dra gzung byar med cing gsog dang ni //
translated: And in the noble Gaganaga√±ja S≈´tra,üîΩThrough one thing, all phenomena are understood to be like illusions, like mirages, ungraspable, hollow,

original: brdzun zhing ther zug min par rjes su rtogs gyur pa //
analyzed: brdzun zhing ther zug min par rjes su rtogs gyur pa //
translated: false, and insubstantial.

original: de ni ring por mi thogs byang chub snying por 'gro //
analyzed: de ni ring por mi thogs byang chub snying por 'gro //
translated: Before long, they will go to the seat of awakening.

original: zhes gsungs so @43b de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so @43b de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the SamƒÅdhirƒÅja S≈´tra,

original: ji ltar khyod kyis bdag gi 'du shes ni //
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis bdag gi 'du shes ni //
translated: Just as you have the notion of a self

original: shes pa de bzhin kun la blos sbyar bya //
analyzed: shes pa de bzhin kun la blos sbyar bya //
translated: In that way apply your mind to all.

original: chos rnams thams cad de yi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad de yi ngo bo nyid //
translated: The nature of all phenomena

original: rnam par dag pa nam mkha' lta bu yin //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa nam mkha' lta bu yin //
translated: Is pure like space.

original: gcig gis kyang ni thams cad shes //
analyzed: gcig gis kyang ni thams cad shes //
translated: One knows all through one thing,

original: gcig gis kyang ni thams cad mthong //
analyzed: gcig gis kyang ni thams cad mthong //
translated: And one sees all through one thing.

original: ji snyed mang po bshad byas kyang //
analyzed: ji snyed mang po bshad byas kyang //
translated: Even though one explains many things,

original: de la dregs pa skye ba med //üîΩces gsungs so //üîΩslob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: de la dregs pa skye ba med // ces gsungs so // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: There is no pride in that.

original: phung po brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /üîΩ// /'dir smras pa khams rnams ni yod de /
analyzed: phung po brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o / // /'dir smras pa khams rnams ni yod de /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the fourth chapter, the chapter on the aggregates, in the Ornament of the Middle Way.

original: bkag pa ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkag pa ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here someone might say, ‚ÄúThe constituents exist because they are not refuted.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said,

original: rgyal po chen po skyes bu gang zag 'di ni khams drug pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po skyes bu gang zag 'di ni khams drug pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄòGreat King, this person has six constituents.‚Äô

original: de'i phyir gsung rab 'don pa las na khams bzhin du phung po dang skye mched kyang yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsung rab 'don pa las na khams bzhin du phung po dang skye mched kyang yod do //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates and sense spheres exist like the elements, since they are mentioned in the scriptures.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te khams rnams nyid yod na phung po dang skye mched rnams yod par 'gyur na de dag ni med do //
analyzed: gal te khams rnams nyid yod na phung po dang skye mched rnams yod par 'gyur na de dag ni med do //
translated: If the elements existed, the aggregates and sense spheres would exist. But they do not exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na bshad pa /
translated: How so? It is said:

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
translated: Prior to the characteristics of space,

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: space does not exist in the least.

original: gal te mtshan las sngar gyur na //
analyzed: gal te mtshan las sngar gyur na //
translated: If it existed prior to the characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: it would follow it is without characteristics.

original: de la khams drug gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: de la khams drug gsungs pa ni //
translated: The six elements are taught:

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rnams so //üîΩde la nam mkha'i dbang du byas nas sun dbyung ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rnams so // de la nam mkha'i dbang du byas nas sun dbyung ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness.üîΩHere, we will discuss the refutation from the perspective of space.

original: 'dir nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni sgrib pa med pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'dir nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni sgrib pa med pa zhes bya la /
translated: The characteristic of space is said to be nonobstructiveness.

original: gal te sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid 'di las sngar mtshan gzhi nam mkha' yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sgrib pa med pa'i mtshan nyid 'di las sngar mtshan gzhi nam mkha' yod par gyur na /
translated: If the basis of those characteristics existed prior to the characteristics of space,

original: de la mtshan nyid 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: then the characteristics would apply to it.

original: mtshan nyid sgrib pa med pa'i snga rol du nam mkha' yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid sgrib pa med pa'i snga rol du nam mkha' yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But space does not exist prior to the characteristic of space.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar /
translated: When it is like this,

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid snga rol na //
translated: prior to the characteristic of space,üîΩspace does not exist in the least.

original: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin pa de'i tshe gang du mtshan nyid 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: nam mkha' cung zad yod ma yin pa de'i tshe gang du mtshan nyid 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: When that is the case, to what would the characteristic apply?

original: de med na nam mkha'i me tog ltar nam mkha' med do zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: de med na nam mkha'i me tog ltar nam mkha' med do zhes bshad pa /
translated: If it does not exist, then like a sky flower, space does not exist.

original: gal te mtshan las sngar gyur na //
analyzed: gal te mtshan las sngar gyur na //
translated: If it existed prior to the characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: it would follow that it would be without characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni //
translated: An entity without characteristics

original: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist anywhere.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: @44a * // re zhig mtshan nyid 'jug pa ni yod la //üîΩde yang mtshan gzhi la yin pas //
analyzed: @44a * // re zhig mtshan nyid 'jug pa ni yod la // de yang mtshan gzhi la yin pas //
translated: First, the application of characteristics exists.üîΩMoreover, it exists in relation to the basis of those characteristics.

original: de yod pas na mtshan gzhi yang yod do //
analyzed: de yod pas na mtshan gzhi yang yod do //
translated: Since that exists, the basis of those characteristics also exists.

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos med na //
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te / 'di ltar / mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos med na //
translated: As it is said:üîΩHow could a characteristic be instantiated

original: mtshan nyid gang du 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang du 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: in a thing that does not have a characteristic?

original: mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po med do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi snga rol na mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po med do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that prior to the characteristic there is no thing that does not have a characteristic.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po med cing mi bdog na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po med cing mi bdog na /
translated: Therefore, since a thing that does not have a characteristic does not exist and is not possible,

original: da ni mtshan nyid gang du 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni mtshan nyid gang du 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: how could a characteristic be instantiated?

original: des na mtshan nyid 'jug pa med do //üîΩgzhan yang / mtshan nyid la 'jug pa na mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: des na mtshan nyid 'jug pa med do // gzhan yang / mtshan nyid la 'jug pa na mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the instantiation of a characteristic does not exist.

original: mtshan nyid med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Moreover, when a characteristic is instantiated, it would be instantiated in something that has a characteristic or it would be instantiated in something that does not have a characteristic.üîΩBut it is not tenable that either is the case.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa //üîΩmtshan nyid med la mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa // mtshan nyid med la mtshan nyid ni //
translated: As it is said:üîΩA characteristic is not instantiated

original: mi 'jug mtshan nyid bcas la min //üîΩmtshan bcas mtshan nyid med pa las //
analyzed: mi 'jug mtshan nyid bcas la min // mtshan bcas mtshan nyid med pa las //
translated: in that which does not have a characteristic, nor in that which does.

original: gzhan la'ang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la'ang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also not instantiated in anything otherüîΩthan that which has or does not have a characteristic.

original: de la mtshan nyid med pa la ni mtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid med pa la ni mtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not tenable that a characteristic is instantiated in a thing that does not have a characteristic,

original: bong bu'i rva la bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva la bya ba bzhin no //
translated: just as a rabbit‚Äôs horns do not have a characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po la yang mtshan nyid 'jug pa mi 'thad de dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po la yang mtshan nyid 'jug pa mi 'thad de dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it tenable that a characteristic is instantiated in a thing that does have a characteristic, because there would be no purpose for that.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan par grub pa la slar yang mtshan nyid dang ldan pas bya ba ci yod na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan par grub pa la slar yang mtshan nyid dang ldan pas bya ba ci yod na /
translated: What would be the point of a thing that already has a characteristic acquiring a characteristic again?

original: de ltar na thug pa med par thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na thug pa med par thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'di ni nam yang mtshan nyid dang bcas pa ma yin par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'di ni nam yang mtshan nyid dang bcas pa ma yin par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: But it is not the case that a thing that has a characteristic is never without a characteristic.

original: rtag tu mtshan nyid 'jug par thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: rtag tu mtshan nyid 'jug par thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, it follows that a characteristic would always be instantiated.

original: de ltar ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no // de'i phyir mtshan nyid dang bcas pa'i dngos po la yang mtshan nyid 'jug par 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that a characteristic is instantiated in a thing that has a characteristic, because there would be no purpose for that.

original: de la 'di snyam du mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa gnyis las gzhan pa zhig la 'jug par 'dod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du mtshan nyid dang bcas pa dang mtshan nyid med pa gnyis las gzhan pa zhig la 'jug par 'dod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it engages in something other than that which has a characteristic and that which does not have a characteristic,

original: brjod par bya ste /üîΩmtshan bcas mtshan nyid med pa las //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / mtshan bcas mtshan nyid med pa las //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this point:üîΩIt does not engage

original: gzhan la'ang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la'ang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In something other than that which has a characteristic and that which does not have a characteristic.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible.

original: gal te mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yin na ni /
translated: If it has a characteristic,

original: mtshan nyid med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ma yin no //
translated: it does not not have a characteristic.

original: de ste mtshan nyid med pa yin na ni mtshan nyid dang bcas pa ma yin te /üîΩde'i phyir mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ste mtshan nyid med pa yin na ni mtshan nyid dang bcas pa ma yin te / de'i phyir mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yang yin la /
translated: But if it does not have a characteristic, it does not have a characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba yin no /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal ba yin no /
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory to say that it both has a characteristic and does not have a characteristic.

original: 'gal @44b ba dag ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal @44b ba dag ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is impossible for something contradictory to exist.

original: de'i phyir mi srid pas mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi srid pas mtshan nyid dang bcas pa yang yin la /
translated: Therefore, because it is impossible, it does not have a characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid med pa yang yin pa la mtshan nyid 'jug pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa yang yin pa la mtshan nyid 'jug pa mi 'thad do //
translated: And it is untenable that a characteristic would be engaged in that which is without a characteristic.

original: ci ste yang gal te mtshan nyid 'jug pa med pa de ltar na yang mtshan gzhi yod do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang gal te mtshan nyid 'jug pa med pa de ltar na yang mtshan gzhi yod do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that even if the engagement of a characteristic does not exist, still a basis of those characteristics exists,

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then this also does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: mtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin na //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin na //
translated: Without the engagement of a characteristic,

original: mtshan gzhi 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A basis of those characteristics is not tenable.

original: gang gi tshe mtshan nyid 'jug pa nyid med pa de'i tshe ji ltar mtshan gzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mtshan nyid 'jug pa nyid med pa de'i tshe ji ltar mtshan gzhir 'gyur te /
translated: When the engagement of a characteristic does not exist, then how could a basis of those characteristics exist?üîΩIt does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: khyod kyis 'jug pa bkag pa yin gyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'jug pa bkag pa yin gyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: You have refuted the engagement of a characteristic, but you have not refuted a characteristic.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid yod pas mtshan gzhi yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid yod pas mtshan gzhi yang yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since a characteristic exists, a basis of those characteristics also exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /üîΩmtshan gzhi 'thad pa ma yin na //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / mtshan gzhi 'thad pa ma yin na //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩWithout a basis of those characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid kyang ni yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩmtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin na //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang ni yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩmtshan nyid 'jug pa ma yin na //
translated: A characteristic also does not exist.

original: mtshan gzhi 'thad par mi 'gyur ro//
analyzed: mtshan gzhi 'thad par mi 'gyur ro//
translated: The basis of those characteristics would not be tenable.

original: zhes bstan pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa de'i tshe /
translated: When this is taught,

original: mtshan gzhi 'thad pa ma yin dang // mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi 'thad pa ma yin dang // mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the basis of those characteristics is not tenable, and the characteristics also do not exist because they have no basis.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When characteristics do not exist in that way,

original: mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir mtshan gzhi yang yod do zhes gang smras pa de med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir mtshan gzhi yang yod do zhes gang smras pa de med do //
translated: then that which was said, ‚ÄúThe basis of those characteristics exists because the characteristics exist,‚Äù does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
translated: Since this is so,

original: de'i phyir mtshan gzhi yod min te //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan gzhi yod min te //
translated: the basis of those characteristics does not exist.

original: mtshan nyid yod pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa nyid ma yin //
translated: The characteristics do not exist.

original: zhes mjug bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes mjug bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is the summary.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgal te yang mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dag med pa de lta na yang dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gal te yang mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dag med pa de lta na yang dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' yod pa yin la /
translated: Here someone might say,üîΩ‚ÄúEven though characteristics and the basis of those characteristics do not exist, space, the nature of things, exists.

original: nam mkha' dngos po'i rang bzhin can du gyur na ni mtshan gzhi 'am mtshan nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dngos po'i rang bzhin can du gyur na ni mtshan gzhi 'am mtshan nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: If space were the nature of things, it would also be the basis of those characteristics or the characteristics themselves.

original: de'i phyir mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag kyang yod do //
translated: Therefore, the characterized and the characteristic exist.

original: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes bshad pa //
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes bshad pa //
translated: This is also unreasonable, as has been explained.

original: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: Apart from the characterized and the characteristic,

original: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
translated: an entity does not exist.

original: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ji ltar med pa de ltar ni gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ji ltar med pa de ltar ni gong du bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained above how the characterized and the characteristic do not exist.

original: gang gi tshe 'di dag med pa de'i tshe mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog ltar nam mkha' med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di dag med pa de'i tshe mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog ltar nam mkha' med do //
translated: When they do not exist, then, because it is devoid of the characterized and the characteristic, space does not exist, like a sky flower.

original: gal te nam mkha' dngos por gyur pa med na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' dngos por gyur pa med na /
translated: If space does not exist as an entity,

original: 'o na dngos po med pa yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po med pa yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then nonentity would exist.

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin @45a * //
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin @45a * //
translated: This also does not exist.

original: te / 'di ltar /
analyzed: te / 'di ltar /
translated: Thus:

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If an entity does not exist,

original: dngos med gang gi yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos med gang gi yin par 'gyur //
translated: whose nonentity would it be?

original: gang gi tshe nam mkha' dngos po ma yin pa de'i tshe dngos po yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nam mkha' dngos po ma yin pa de'i tshe dngos po yod pa ma yin na /
translated: When space is not an entity, then an entity does not exist.

original: dngos po med pa gang gi yin par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang gi yin par brtag par bya ste /
translated: What could be imagined to be nonexistent?

original: gal te dngos po ma grub na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma grub na /
translated: If an existent is not established,

original: dngos po med pa 'grub mi 'gyur //üîΩdngos po gzhan du gyur pa la //
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'grub mi 'gyur // dngos po gzhan du gyur pa la //
translated: a nonexistent is not established.üîΩPeople say that a transformation of an existent

original: dngos po med ces skye bo smra /
analyzed: dngos po med ces skye bo smra /
translated: is called a nonexistent.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pas nam mkha' dngos po med pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pas nam mkha' dngos po med pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, since an existent is not established, space, a nonexistent, does not exist.

original: nam mkha' dngos po zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa la rnam par gzhag ste //
analyzed: nam mkha' dngos po zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa la rnam par gzhag ste //
translated: Space is called a non-existent form.

original: de'i phyir gal te gzugs yod na ni de'i tshe gzugs med pa la nam mkha' zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gzugs yod na ni de'i tshe gzugs med pa la nam mkha' zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if form exists, then at that time it would be called space, a non-existent form.

original: gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa rigs pas gzugs nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe gang gi dngos po med pa nam mkha' 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa rigs pas gzugs nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe gang gi dngos po med pa nam mkha' 'gyur /
translated: But when form itself does not exist as it has been explained through reasoning, then what nonexistent thing would be space?

original: 'dir de dag ni yongs su rtogs par byed pa po yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir de dag ni yongs su rtogs par byed pa po yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, they say: ‚ÄúSince the one who fully understands exists,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis ni yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis ni yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: both an existent and a nonexistent exist.‚Äù

original: gang zhig 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di skad du /
translated: Someone says this:

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If an entity does not exist,

original: dngos med gang gi yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos med gang gi yin par 'gyur //
translated: whose nonentity would it be?

original: zhes smra ba dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi yongs su rtog par byed pa khyod yod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: zhes smra ba dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi yongs su rtog par byed pa khyod yod pa yang yin te /
translated: You who imagine entities and nonentities exist,

original: de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog par byed pa khyod yod pas brtag bya dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis kyang yod pa yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog par byed pa khyod yod pas brtag bya dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis kyang yod pa yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: therefore, since you who imagine entities and nonentities exist, the two, entities and nonentities, which are imagined, also exist.

original: brjod pa 'di yang mi rung ste //
analyzed: brjod pa 'di yang mi rung ste //
translated: This statement is not correct.üîΩWhy is it not correct?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: dngos dang dngos med mi mthun chos //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med mi mthun chos //
translated: Entities and nonentities are incompatible phenomena.

original: gang gis dngos dang dngos med shes //
analyzed: gang gis dngos dang dngos med shes //
translated: By what means would one know entities and nonentities?

original: gal te de gnyis kyi rtog par byed pa po yod na ni //
analyzed: gal te de gnyis kyi rtog par byed pa po yod na ni //
translated: If the one who imagines those two exists,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu yang 'gyur na /
translated: then entities and nonentities would also exist.

original: yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it does not exist.

original: yod na yongs su rtog par byed pa gang yin pa de dngos po 'am dngos po med pa zhig tu 'gyur grang /
analyzed: yod na yongs su rtog par byed pa gang yin pa de dngos po 'am dngos po med pa zhig tu 'gyur grang /
translated: If it existed, then that which imagines would be either an entity or a nonentity.

original: gal te dngos po yin par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po yin par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that it is a thing,üîΩthen the refutation of this has already been taught:

original: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: Apart from the characterized and the characteristic,

original: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po yang ni yod ma yin //
translated: there is no other thing.üîΩIf, on the other hand, you assert that it is a non-thing,

original: zhes 'di'i sun 'byin pa bstan zin to //üîΩ'on te / dngos po med pa yin na ni //üîΩdngos po yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: zhes 'di'i sun 'byin pa bstan zin to // 'on te / dngos po med pa yin na ni // dngos po yod pa ma yin na //
translated: then the refutation of this has already been explained:üîΩIf a thing does not exist,

original: dngos med gang gi yin par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba der sun 'byin pa bshad zin to //üîΩgang zhig 'di gnyis kyi rtog par byed par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: dngos med gang gi yin par 'gyur // zhes bya ba der sun 'byin pa bshad zin to // gang zhig 'di gnyis kyi rtog par byed par 'gyur ba /
translated: then whose non-thing would it be?üîΩThere is no third alternative apart from these two that could be imagined,

original: dngos po med @45b pa dang chos mi mthun pa gsum pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med @45b pa dang chos mi mthun pa gsum pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not tenable that a non-thing is similar to a thing.

original: de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi yongs su rtog par byed pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gi yongs su rtog par byed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the imagination of a thing and a non-thing does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn also said:

original: gang gis dngos rnams dngos med shes pa de //
analyzed: gang gis dngos rnams dngos med shes pa de //
translated: One who knows things as non-things

original: nam yang dngos po kun la chags mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nam yang dngos po kun la chags mi 'gyur //
translated: will never be attached to any thing.

original: gang zhig nam yang dngos kun chags med pa //
analyzed: gang zhig nam yang dngos kun chags med pa //
translated: One who is never attached to any thing

original: de ni ting 'dzin mtshan ma med la reg / ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ni ting 'dzin mtshan ma med la reg / ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: gang dag chos rnams stong la sems byed pa'i //
analyzed: gang dag chos rnams stong la sems byed pa'i //
translated: Those who think about phenomena as empty,

original: byis pa de dag lam ngan zhugs pa yin //
analyzed: byis pa de dag lam ngan zhugs pa yin //
translated: Those childish beings have entered a bad path.

original: chos rnams stong pa yi ges brjod pa yin /
analyzed: chos rnams stong pa yi ges brjod pa yin /
translated: Phenomena are empty, expressed by words.

original: de dag yi ge med par yi ges bstan //
analyzed: de dag yi ge med par yi ges bstan //
translated: They are wordless, taught by words.

original: gang dag zhi zhing rab zhi'i chos sems pa'i //
analyzed: gang dag zhi zhing rab zhi'i chos sems pa'i //
translated: Those who think about phenomena as peaceful and thoroughly peaceful,

original: sems dpa' de yang nam yang byung ma yin //
analyzed: sems dpa' de yang nam yang byung ma yin //
translated: Those beings never arise.

original: spros kun sems kyi rnam par rtog yin te //
analyzed: spros kun sems kyi rnam par rtog yin te //
translated: All elaborations are conceptual thoughts of the mind,

original: de'i phyir chos rnams bsam yas rtogs par gyis //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos rnams bsam yas rtogs par gyis //
translated: Therefore, understand phenomena to be inconceivable.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: da ni ji ltar bstan pa de ltar mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar bstan pa de ltar mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to summarize as taught,

original: de phyir nam mkha'i dngos po min //
analyzed: de phyir nam mkha'i dngos po min //
translated: Therefore, it is not an entity of space,

original: dngos med ma yin mtshan gzhi min //
analyzed: dngos med ma yin mtshan gzhi min //
translated: It is not a non-entity, it is not a basis of characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is not a characteristic.

original: nam mkha' ji lta ba de bzhin du khams lnga po gzhan gang dag kyang nam mkha' mtshungs /
analyzed: nam mkha' ji lta ba de bzhin du khams lnga po gzhan gang dag kyang nam mkha' mtshungs /
translated: Just as with space, so should you understand the other five elements to be like space.

original: sa la sogs pa'i khams lnga po gzhan gang dag lhag mar gyur pa de dag kyang nam mkha' ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mtshan gzhi dang / mtshan nyid dang bral bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khams lnga po gzhan gang dag lhag mar gyur pa de dag kyang nam mkha' ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang mtshan gzhi dang / mtshan nyid dang bral bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The remaining five elements, such as earth, should be understood to be like space, free from entity and nonentity, the basis of characteristics and characteristics.üîΩThis is the meaning. Therefore, the nature of things is such that it abides.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin de ltar rnam par gnas pa yin dang / ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams par gyur pa nyid kyis 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa phyin ci log tu lta ba goms pa rang bzhin med pa phyin ci ma log par mthong
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin de ltar rnam par gnas pa yin dang / ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis blo gros kyi mig nyams par gyur pa nyid kyis 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa phyin ci log tu lta ba goms pa rang bzhin med pa phyin ci ma log par mthong
translated: And because the eye of the mind is impaired by the cataracts of ignorance, from beginningless cyclic existence one has been accustomed to the mistaken views of entity, nonentity, and so on.

original: ba'i lam mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun par 'gro ba las nyams pa /
analyzed: ba'i lam mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun par 'gro ba las nyams pa /
translated: One has fallen from the unmistaken seeing of the absence of intrinsic existence, the path that leads to nirvana.

original: blo chung gang dag dngos rnams la //
analyzed: blo chung gang dag dngos rnams la //
translated: Those of little intelligence

original: yod pa nyid dang med nyid du //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang med nyid du //
translated: The view of existence and nonexistence

original: lta ba de ni blta bya ba //
analyzed: lta ba de ni blta bya ba //
translated: Does not see the pacification of views.üîΩThe view of existence and nonexistence

original: nye bar zhi ba zhi mi mthong //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba zhi mi mthong //
translated: Does not see the pacification of views.

original: blo zhan pa nyid kyis yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa blta bar bya ba nye bar zhi zhing zhi ba'i mtshan nyid rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: blo zhan pa nyid kyis yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa blta bar bya ba nye bar zhi zhing zhi ba'i mtshan nyid rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: Those who are of weak intellect and are attached to existence and nonexistence do not see nirvana, which is characterized by pacification and peace, and is free from all conceptual thought.

original: shes pa @46a * //üîΩdang shes bya log pa'i ngo bo don dam pa /
analyzed: shes pa @46a * // dang shes bya log pa'i ngo bo don dam pa /
translated: It is the ultimate,

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can mi mthong ngo //üîΩji skad du /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can mi mthong ngo // ji skad du /
translated: the nature of which is emptiness, and which is the cessation of the cognizer and the cognized.

original: rin po che'i phreng ba las /
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba las /
translated: As it is said in the Ratnavali:

original: med pa pa ni ngan 'gror 'gro //
analyzed: med pa pa ni ngan 'gror 'gro //
translated: The nihilist goes to a bad rebirth;

original: yod pa pa ni bde 'gror 'gro //
analyzed: yod pa pa ni bde 'gror 'gro //
translated: The realist goes to a good rebirth.

original: yang dag ji bzhin yongs shes phyir //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin yongs shes phyir //
translated: By fully understanding reality as it is,

original: gnyis la mi brten thar par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis la mi brten thar par 'gyur // zhes bshad do //
translated: One becomes free, not relying on either.

original: mdo las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: mdo las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: And in the sutra, the Lord has said:

original: yod dang med ces bya ba gnyi ga mtha' //
analyzed: yod dang med ces bya ba gnyi ga mtha' //
translated: ‚ÄúExistence‚Äù and ‚Äúnonexistence‚Äù are both extremes.

original: dag dang ma dag 'di yang mtha' yin no //
analyzed: dag dang ma dag 'di yang mtha' yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúPure‚Äù and ‚Äúimpure‚Äù are also extremes.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i mtha' ni rnam spangs nas //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i mtha' ni rnam spangs nas //
translated: Therefore, having abandoned both extremes,

original: mkhas pas dbus la'ang gnas par yod mi byed //
analyzed: mkhas pas dbus la'ang gnas par yod mi byed //
translated: the wise do not abide even in the middle.

original: yod dang med ces bya ba rtsod pa ste //
analyzed: yod dang med ces bya ba rtsod pa ste //
translated: To say ‚Äúexists‚Äù or ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is to argue;

original: dag dang ma dag 'di yang rtsod pa yin //
analyzed: dag dang ma dag 'di yang rtsod pa yin //
translated: to say ‚Äúis pure‚Äù or ‚Äúis impure‚Äù is to argue.

original: rtsod par gyur pa sdug bsngal zhi mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rtsod par gyur pa sdug bsngal zhi mi 'gyur //
translated: Those who argue will not pacify suffering;

original: rtsod pa med par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal 'gag / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa med par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal 'gag / ces gsungs so //
translated: those who do not argue will stop suffering.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba'i lam gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dam pa 'thob pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni srid pa ma yin no /üîΩslob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba'i lam gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dam pa 'thob pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni srid pa ma yin no / slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to attain the highest nirvana by the path of samsara.

original: khams brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa lnga pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: khams brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa lnga pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the fifth chapter, the analysis of the elements, in the root text of the Treatise on the Middle Way, composed by the masterüîΩCandrakƒ´rti.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: the aggregates, constituents, and sources do exist,

original: de'i rten can kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten can kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their basis, the thoroughly afflicted, is observed.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de'i rten can gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de'i rten can gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni dmigs pa med de /
translated: The defilement of those who have no object does not exist here.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu dang mo gsham gyi bu mo'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu dang mo gsham gyi bu mo'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the defilement of the son of a barren woman and the daughter of a barren woman.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dag ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dag ni yod pa yin te /
translated: The causes of defilement such as attachment do exist.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As the Lord has said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa rtag par lhung ba ni mig gi gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas su mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa rtag par lhung ba ni mig gi gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde ba'i gnas su mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, the foolish common person, who is not learned, is always falling into the view of permanence, and when he sees forms with the eye, he becomes attached to them.

original: de mngon par zhen par gyur nas 'dod chags skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de mngon par zhen par gyur nas 'dod chags skyed par byed do //
translated: Having become attached, he generates desire.

original: chags par gyur nas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'dod chags las byung ba'i las mngon par 'du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chags par gyur nas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'dod chags las byung ba'i las mngon par 'du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having become desirous, he performs actions with body, speech, and mind that are born of desire.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äù And so on at length.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa dag nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa dag nyid yod na /
translated: If attachment and so on exist,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams yod par 'gyur na /
translated: then the aggregates, elements, and sense bases would exist.

original: yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But they do not exist.

original: 'dir 'dod chags 'di yongs su @46b brtags pa na /üîΩchags pa yod pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir 'dod chags 'di yongs su @46b brtags pa na / chags pa yod pa'am /
translated: Here, when attachment is thoroughly investigated,üîΩif the attached one exists,

original: med pa na rtog pa zhig na /
analyzed: med pa na rtog pa zhig na /
translated: or if the attached one does not exist,üîΩboth are untenable.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi rung ngo zhes bshad pa /üîΩgal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi rung ngo zhes bshad pa / gal te 'dod chags snga rol na //
translated: This has been explained.üîΩIf prior to attachment

original: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i chags yod na //
translated: the attached one exists without attachment,

original: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'dod chags yod //
translated: then attachment would depend on that.

original: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: chags yod 'dod chags yod par 'gyur //
translated: If the attached one exists, attachment would exist.

original: 'dod chags dang / chags zhen dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / phrad zhen dang / mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / chags zhen dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / phrad zhen dang / mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs so //
translated: The terms ‚Äúattachment,‚Äù ‚Äúclinging,‚Äù ‚Äúexcessive attachment,‚Äù ‚Äúattachment to contact,‚Äù and ‚Äúmanifest attachment‚Äù are synonyms.

original: chags pa ni 'dod chags kyi rten yin te /
analyzed: chags pa ni 'dod chags kyi rten yin te /
translated: The attached one is the basis of attachment.

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi snga rol na /
translated: If prior to attachment

original: 'dod chags med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa ste /
translated: the attached one exists without attachment,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yod par gyur na ni /
translated: that is, if the attached one exists free from attachment,üîΩthen attachment would depend on that.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chags pa de la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chags pa de la brten nas 'dod chags yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Attachment exists in dependence on the one who is attached.

original: de lta na ni chags pa yod na 'dod chags yod do zhes bya ba rigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na ni chags pa yod na 'dod chags yod do zhes bya ba rigs par 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, it would be logical to say that attachment exists when the one who is attached exists.

original: 'dod chags dang bral yang chags pa yin par 'gyur pa gang yin pa de lta bu ni med de /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral yang chags pa yin par 'gyur pa gang yin pa de lta bu ni med de /
translated: But it is not like that, for even though one is free of attachment, one is still the one who is attached.

original: dgra bcom pa dag la yang chags pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te de ltar chags pa yod pa na 'dod chags med na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag la yang chags pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gal te de ltar chags pa yod pa na 'dod chags med na /
translated: This is because it follows that even arhats would have attachment.üîΩBut if attachment does not exist when the one who is attached exists,

original: 'o na chags pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na chags pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then the one who is attached does not exist.

original: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa /üîΩchags pa yod par ma gyur na'ang //
analyzed: 'di yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa / chags pa yod par ma gyur na'ang //
translated: This is also illogical, as explained in the following:üîΩHow could attachment exist

original: 'dod chags yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod chags yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: when the one who is attached does not exist?

original: gang gi tshe chags pa yod pa na 'dod chags yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /üîΩji ltar chags pa yod par ma gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chags pa yod pa na 'dod chags yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe / ji ltar chags pa yod par ma gyur pa na /
translated: When the one who is attached does not exist, attachment does not exist.üîΩHow could attachment existüîΩwhen the one who is attached does not exist?

original: rten med pa'i 'dod chags grub par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten med pa'i 'dod chags grub par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could attachment exist without a basis?

original: shing thog med par de'i smin pa nyid yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shing thog med par de'i smin pa nyid yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But without the fruit, its ripening would not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: gal te yang khyod kyis 'dod chags bkag mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang khyod kyis 'dod chags bkag mod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough you have refuted attachment,

original: de lta na yang chags pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang chags pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: nevertheless, the one who is attached exists,

original: ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has not been refuted.‚Äù

original: chags pa yang 'dod chags med par ni mi rigs te de'i phyir 'di yang yod do //
analyzed: chags pa yang 'dod chags med par ni mi rigs te de'i phyir 'di yang yod do //
translated: And it is not tenable that the one who is attached exists without attachment. Therefore, this also exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gal te chags pa yod na 'dod chags yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te chags pa yod na 'dod chags yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the one who is attached existed, attachment would exist.

original: yod pa ni ma yin te//
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin te//
translated: But it does not exist.

original: 'di ltar chags pa 'di 'dod pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar chags pa 'di 'dod pa na /
translated: In this way, if you imagine that the one who is attached exists,

original: 'dod chags yod pa'ang med pa na rtog grang na /
analyzed: 'dod chags yod pa'ang med pa na rtog grang na /
translated: then attachment would exist without the one who is attached.üîΩBut it is not tenable in any way.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa /üîΩchags pa la yang 'dod chags ni //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa / chags pa la yang 'dod chags ni //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe one who is attached

original: yod dam med kyang rim pa mtshungs //
analyzed: yod dam med kyang rim pa mtshungs //
translated: Would be the same whether attachment exists or not.

original: de la gal te 'dod chags yod pa na chags pa yod par rtog par byed @47a * //
analyzed: de la gal te 'dod chags yod pa na chags pa yod par rtog par byed @47a * //
translated: In this regard, if you imagine that the one who is attached exists when attachment exists,

original: na ni / de lta na yang /
analyzed: na ni / de lta na yang /
translated: then in that case,

original: gal te chags pa'i snga rol na //
analyzed: gal te chags pa'i snga rol na //
translated: If the one who is attached existed prior to attachment,

original: chags med 'dod chags yod na ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pas chags pa la yang bshad ma thag pa 'dod chags mi 'thad pa'i rim pa 'di nyid mtshungs so //
analyzed: chags med 'dod chags yod na ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pas chags pa la yang bshad ma thag pa 'dod chags mi 'thad pa'i rim pa 'di nyid mtshungs so //
translated: If attachment existed without one who is attached,

original: ci ste 'dod chags med par chags pa 'dod na ni /
analyzed: ci ste 'dod chags med par chags pa 'dod na ni /
translated: then one who is attached would exist without attachment.

original: 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: But this is not tenable.üîΩIf one who is attached existed without attachment, then attachment would exist without one who is attached.üîΩBut this is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags yod par ma gyur na'ang //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags yod par ma gyur na'ang //
translated: If attachment did not exist,

original: chags pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: chags pa yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could one who is attached exist?

original: de'i phyir chags pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chags pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore one who is attached does not exist.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa med pa'i phyir na phung po la sogs pa dag kyang med do //üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa med pa'i phyir na phung po la sogs pa dag kyang med do // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Since neither attachment nor one who is attached exist, the aggregates and so on also do not exist.

original: gang las skyon 'dir 'gyur ba 'dod chags dang chags pa dag snga phyir 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang las skyon 'dir 'gyur ba 'dod chags dang chags pa dag snga phyir 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Objection: Attachment and one who is attached do not occur sequentially, so how could this error arise?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Response: Then what?

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ni lhan cig kho nar 'byung ste /üîΩsems dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'dod chags kyis /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ni lhan cig kho nar 'byung ste / sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'dod chags kyis /
translated: Attachment and one who is attached occur simultaneously.

original: sems chags par byas la /
analyzed: sems chags par byas la /
translated: The attachment that occurs simultaneously with the mind makes the mind attached.

original: de la chags pa yin te /
analyzed: de la chags pa yin te /
translated: That is one who is attached.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang chags pa dag yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang chags pa dag yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, attachment and one who is attached exist.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: Even so,üîΩit is not logical that attachment and one who is attached

original: 'dod chags dang ni chags pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ni chags pa dag / lhan cig nyid du skye mi rigs //
translated: arise simultaneously.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis lhan cig skye ba yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis lhan cig skye ba yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that attachment and one who is attached arise simultaneously.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is it so?üîΩBecause in that case, attachment and one who is attached

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / phan tshun ltos pa med par 'gyur //
translated: would not be mutually dependent.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang 'dod chags dang chags pa 'di dag lhan cig pa nyid du gcig nyid dam /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin no snyam du dgongs pa'o // gzhan yang 'dod chags dang chags pa 'di dag lhan cig pa nyid du gcig nyid dam /
translated: They would be like the right and left horns of an ox, because they would arise simultaneously.üîΩMoreover, do you imagine that attachment and one who is attached are simultaneous and identical,

original: tha dad pa zhig la rtog grang /
analyzed: tha dad pa zhig la rtog grang /
translated: or that they are simultaneous and different?

original: de la gal te gcig nyid la yin na ni de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la gal te gcig nyid la yin na ni de mi rung ngo //
translated: If you imagine that they are identical, that is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de /
analyzed: gcig nyid lhan cig nyid med de /
translated: Identity is not simultaneity.

original: yang ci'i phyir med ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir med ce na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
analyzed: de nyid de dang lhan cig min //
translated: It is not the same as itself.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid 'dod chags las tha mi dad pa ni 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin no /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags kyi rang gi bdag nyid 'dod chags las tha mi dad pa ni 'dod chags dang lhan cig pa yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin no /
translated: Thus, it is not said that the intrinsic reality of desire, which is not different from desire, is simultaneous with desire.

original: da ni tha dad pa nyid la yang lhan cig pa nyid med par bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni tha dad pa nyid la yang lhan cig pa nyid med par bshad pa /
translated: Now, it is explained that even if they are different, they are not simultaneous:

original: ci ste tha dad nyid med na //
analyzed: ci ste tha dad nyid med na //
translated: If they are not different,

original: lhan cig tu ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: lhan cig tu ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could they be simultaneous?

original: snang ba dang mun pa'am 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa tha dad par gyur pa dag la ni lhan cig pa nyid ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: snang ba dang mun pa'am 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa tha dad par gyur pa dag la ni lhan cig pa nyid ma mthong ngo //
translated: The simultaneous occurrence of light and darkness or of cyclic existence and nirvana is not seen in things that are different.

original: gzhan yang / gal te gcig pu lhan @47b cig na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te gcig pu lhan @47b cig na //
translated: Moreover, if one thing were simultaneous with itself,

original: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be so even without a companion.

original: gal te tha dad lhan cig na //
analyzed: gal te tha dad lhan cig na //
translated: If different things were simultaneous,

original: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs med par yang der 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be so even without a companion.

original: gal te gcig nyid la lhan cig pa nyid du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid la lhan cig pa nyid du 'gyur na ni /
translated: If one thing were simultaneous with itself,

original: de'i tshe gang dang gang na gcig nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig pa nyid yod do zhes bya bas gcig pu zhig  la yang lhan cig pa nyid yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang dang gang na gcig nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig pa nyid yod do zhes bya bas gcig pu zhig  la yang lhan cig pa nyid yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, since it is said, ‚ÄúWherever there is oneness, there is togetherness,‚Äù then even a single thing would have togetherness.

original: tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig pa nyid 'dod na yang /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig pa nyid 'dod na yang /
translated: Even if you assert that togetherness exists in difference,

original: gang dang gang na tha dad pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig pa nyid yod do zhes bya bas ba lang rta la sogs pa las tha dad cing so sor gnas pa grogs med pa la yang lhan cig pa nyid yang yod par 'gyur ro
analyzed: gang dang gang na tha dad pa nyid yod pa de dang de na lhan cig pa nyid yod do zhes bya bas ba lang rta la sogs pa las tha dad cing so sor gnas pa grogs med pa la yang lhan cig pa nyid yang yod par 'gyur ro
translated: since it is said, ‚ÄúWherever there is difference, there is togetherness,‚Äù then even a single thing that is different from a horse, cow, etc., and that exists separately without a companion would have togetherness.

original: // gzhan yang /
analyzed: // gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gal te tha dad lhan cig na //
analyzed: gal te tha dad lhan cig na //
translated: If difference is togetherness,üîΩwould attachment and one who is attached

original: ci go 'dod chags chags pa dag / tha dad nyid du 'grub 'gyur ram //
analyzed: ci go 'dod chags chags pa dag / tha dad nyid du 'grub 'gyur ram //
translated: be established as different?

original: de nas de gnyis lhan cig 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas de gnyis lhan cig 'gyur //
translated: Then those two would be together.

original: gal te yang 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig pa nyid du rtog na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad pa nyid la lhan cig pa nyid du rtog na ni /
translated: If you imagine that attachment and one who is attached are together even though they are different,

original: ci 'di gnyis tha dad pa nyid du grub bam /
analyzed: ci 'di gnyis tha dad pa nyid du grub bam /
translated: are these two established as different?

original: gang las de dag lhan cig pa nyid du 'gyur ba //üîΩci go 'dod chags chags pa la mi ltos pa'am /
analyzed: gang las de dag lhan cig pa nyid du 'gyur ba // ci go 'dod chags chags pa la mi ltos pa'am /
translated: How could they be simultaneous?üîΩIs it established that desire and the desirous one do not rely on each other?

original: chags pa yang 'dod chags la mi ltos pa zhes bya bar grub bam /
analyzed: chags pa yang 'dod chags la mi ltos pa zhes bya bar grub bam /
translated: Or is it established that desire and the desirous one do not rely on each other?

original: 'di ltar tha dad par grub pa'i ba lang dang rta dag kho na la lhan cig pa nyid du mthong ba lta bu yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad par grub pa'i ba lang dang rta dag kho na la lhan cig pa nyid du mthong ba lta bu yin na /
translated: Just as a cow and a horse that are established as different are seen to be simultaneous,

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ni de ltar tha dad par grub pa ma yin pas 'di gnyis la lhan cig pa nyid med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag ni de ltar tha dad par grub pa ma yin pas 'di gnyis la lhan cig pa nyid med do //
translated: but desire and the desirous one are not established as different in that way, so these two are not simultaneous.

original: ci ste yang tha dad par ma grub pa dag la lhan cig pa nyid med pa'i phyir /üîΩgal te 'dod chags chags pa dag / tha dad nyid du grub gyur na ste khyod rtog par 'gyur na da ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i lhan cig pa nyid brtags pas ci zhig bya zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: ci ste yang tha dad par ma grub pa dag la lhan cig pa nyid med pa'i phyir / gal te 'dod chags chags pa dag / tha dad nyid du grub gyur na ste khyod rtog par 'gyur na da ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i lhan cig pa nyid brtags pas ci zhig bya zhes bshad pa /
translated: But if they are not established as different, then because they are not simultaneous,üîΩif desire and the desirous one were established as different,

original: de dag lhan cig nyid du ni //
analyzed: de dag lhan cig nyid du ni //
translated: then you might imagine that they are simultaneous. But now, what is the point of imagining that they are simultaneous and do not perform any function at all?üîΩDesire and the desirous one

original: ci yi phyir na yongs su rtog /'dod chags dang chags pa dag grub par bya ba'i phyir lhan cig pa nyid rtog par byed la /
analyzed: ci yi phyir na yongs su rtog /'dod chags dang chags pa dag grub par bya ba'i phyir lhan cig pa nyid rtog par byed la /
translated: One imagines that they are coexistent in order to establish that attachment and one who is attached exist.

original: de yang tha dad par ma grub pa dag la yod pa ma yin pas tha dad par grub par khas len na ni /
analyzed: de yang tha dad par ma grub pa dag la yod pa ma yin pas tha dad par grub par khas len na ni /
translated: But since that does not exist for those that are not established as different, if one asserts that they are established as different,

original: de ltar grub pa'i phyir 'di dag gi lhan cig pa nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de ltar grub pa'i phyir 'di dag gi lhan cig pa nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: then because they are established in that way, what purpose is there in their being coexistent?üîΩBut if you assert that they are coexistent

original: 'on te / tha dad grub par ma gyur pas //üîΩde phyir lhan cig 'dod byed na ste //
analyzed: 'on te / tha dad grub par ma gyur pas // de phyir lhan cig 'dod byed na ste //
translated: because they are not established as different,

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad par grub pa yod pa ma yin pa'i @48a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dag tha dad par grub pa yod pa ma yin pa'i @48a * //
translated: then since attachment and one who is attached are not established as different,

original: phyir / gal te 'di dag lhan cig pa nyid du 'dod na ni /
analyzed: phyir / gal te 'di dag lhan cig pa nyid du 'dod na ni /
translated: if you assert that they are coexistent,

original: de yang tha dad par ma grub pa dag la yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de yang tha dad par ma grub pa dag la yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: then since that does not exist for those that are not established as different,

original: lhan cig rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lhan cig rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to establish their co-existence,

original: tha dad nyid du yang 'dod dam //
analyzed: tha dad nyid du yang 'dod dam //
translated: do you also assert that they are different?

original: de ltar yin na ni /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni /
