translated: If that is the case,üîΩthen since they are not established as different,üîΩwhat purpose is there in their being coexistent?

original: grub pa phan tshun rten par gnas pa yin dang / de gang grub pas gang zhig grub par 'gyur te /üîΩgang gi phyir /
analyzed: grub pa phan tshun rten par gnas pa yin dang / de gang grub pas gang zhig grub par 'gyur te / gang gi phyir /
translated: And if they are established as mutually dependent, which is established by the establishment of which?

original: tha dad dngos por ma grub pas //
analyzed: tha dad dngos por ma grub pas //
translated: Because they are not established as different things,

original: lhan cig dngos po 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: lhan cig dngos po 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: A thing that is coexistent is not established.

original: tha dad dngos po gang yod na //
analyzed: tha dad dngos po gang yod na //
translated: If a thing that is different exists,

original: lhan cig dngos por 'dod par byed //
analyzed: lhan cig dngos por 'dod par byed //
translated: Why would you assert that it is a coexistent thing?

original: tha dad pa'i dngos po gang zhig yod na /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i dngos po gang zhig yod na /
translated: If a thing that is different exists,üîΩwhy would you assert that it is a coexistent thing?

original: lhan cig pa'i dngos po grub par 'gyur ba lhan cig pa'i dngos po la mi ltos pa tha dad pa'i dngos po de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhan cig pa'i dngos po grub par 'gyur ba lhan cig pa'i dngos po la mi ltos pa tha dad pa'i dngos po de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: A thing that is different and does not rely on a coexistent thing does not exist.

original: de'i phyir mi srid par dgongs nas bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi srid par dgongs nas bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, thinking that this is impossible, it is said:

original: tha dad dngos po gang yod na //
analyzed: tha dad dngos po gang yod na //
translated: If a thing that is different exists,

original: lhan cig dngos por 'dod par byed //
analyzed: lhan cig dngos por 'dod par byed //
translated: Why would you assert that it is a coexistent thing?

original: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pas gzhigs pas 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis ma grub pa mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pas gzhigs pas 'dod chags dang chags pa gnyis ma grub pa mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the analysis that has been explained, desire and one who desires are not established. To conclude this, it is said:

original: de ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags chags pa dag / lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
translated: Thus, desire and the desirous one Are not established as simultaneous or not simultaneous.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags dang chags pa dag snga phyir ma grub la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags dang chags pa dag snga phyir ma grub la /
translated: Just as desire and the desirous one are not established as sequential,üîΩand are not established as simultaneous, so it is with all things.

original: lhan cig pa nyid du yang ma grub pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang yin no zhes bsgre ba'i phyir bshad pa //
analyzed: lhan cig pa nyid du yang ma grub pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang yin no zhes bsgre ba'i phyir bshad pa //
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du chos rnams kun //
translated: Like desire, all things

original: lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
analyzed: lhan cig lhan cig min mi 'grub //
translated: Are not established as simultaneous or not simultaneous.

original: zhe sdang dang sdang ba dang / gti mug dang rmongs pa rnams la yang 'dod chags dang chags pa ltar ma grub par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang sdang ba dang / gti mug dang rmongs pa rnams la yang 'dod chags dang chags pa ltar ma grub par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Aversion and the aversive, confusion and the confused are not established like desire and the desirous one.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: For this very reason, the Transcendent Lord said:

original: gang 'dod chags pa dang / gang la 'dod chags pa dang / gang gis 'dod chags pa dang / gang zhe sdang ba dang / gang la zhe sdang ba dang / gang gis zhe sdang ba dang / gang gti mug pa dang / gang la gti mug pa dang /üîΩgang gis gti mug par 'gyur ba'i chos de des yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing chos de mi dmigs so //üîΩdes chos de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhing ma dmigs pas /
analyzed: gang 'dod chags pa dang / gang la 'dod chags pa dang / gang gis 'dod chags pa dang / gang zhe sdang ba dang / gang la zhe sdang ba dang / gang gis zhe sdang ba dang / gang gti mug pa dang / gang la gti mug pa dang / gang gis gti mug par 'gyur ba'i chos de des yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing chos de mi dmigs so // des chos de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong zhing ma dmigs pas /
translated: He does not see that dharma by which there would be passion, by which there would be hatred, by which there would be delusion, by which there would be passion, by which there would be hatred, by which there would be delusion.üîΩHe does not see that dharma by which there would be passion, by which there would be hatred, by which there would be delusion.

original: 'dod chags med pa zhe sdang med pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa zhe sdang med pa /
translated: He does not see that dharma by which there would be passion, by which there would be hatred, by which there would be delusion.

original: gti mug med pa sems phyin ci ma log pa /üîΩmnyam par gzhag pa @48b zhes bya'o //üîΩbrgal ba pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //üîΩbde bar son pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug med pa sems phyin ci ma log pa / mnyam par gzhag pa @48b zhes bya'o // brgal ba pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o // bde bar son pa zhes bya'o //

original: mi 'jigs pa thob pa zhes bya ba nas zag pa zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa thob pa zhes bya ba nas zag pa zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He does not see that dharma by which there would be passion, by which there would be hatred, by which there would be delusion.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dbang dang ldan par gyur pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dbang dang ldan par gyur pa /
translated: He does not see that dharma by which there would be passion, by which

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: He is one who is completely liberated in mind.

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: He is one who is completely liberated in wisdom.

original: cang shes pa /
analyzed: cang shes pa /
translated: He is one who knows.

original: glang po chen po /üîΩbya ba byas pa /
analyzed: glang po chen po / bya ba byas pa /
translated: He is a great elephant.üîΩHe has done what had to be done.

original: byed pa byas pa /
analyzed: byed pa byas pa /
translated: He has done his duties.

original: khur bor ba /
analyzed: khur bor ba /
translated: He has laid down his burden.

original: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /
translated: He has attained his own goals.

original: srid par kun du sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
analyzed: srid par kun du sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
translated: He has exhausted the fetters of existence.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: He is completely liberated in mind by means of right knowledge.

original: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dge sbyong zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dge sbyong zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: He is a ≈õrama·πáa who has attained the perfection of all the powers of the mind.üîΩAnd so on at length.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And:üîΩThose who know that the nature of desire, hatred, conceit, and delusion

original: gang dag 'dod chags zhe sdang rgyags dang gti mug gi / ngo bo kun rtog gis bskyed log par zhugs shes nas //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod chags zhe sdang rgyags dang gti mug gi / ngo bo kun rtog gis bskyed log par zhugs shes nas //
translated: Is produced by conceptualization and is wrongly engaged,

original: rnam par rtog par mi byed chags bral mi 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par mi byed chags bral mi 'gyur ba'i //
translated: Do not conceptualize, but do not become free from attachment.

original: sgom pa de dag gnas ni dngos po thams cad yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgom pa de dag gnas ni dngos po thams cad yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: Their meditation is based on all things.

original: slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las //
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las //
translated: This is the commentary on the twenty-first chapter, having twenty-twoüîΩverses, called ‚Äúthe examination of the self.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩCHAPTER TWENTY-TWOüîΩExamination of the Prior EntityüîΩExplanation of the ChapterüîΩHere someone might say that although you have refuted the self, sinceüîΩthe prior entity exists, the self exists essentially.üîΩ

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu phyed pa drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu phyed pa drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the sixth chapter, the ‚ÄúExamination of Desire and the Desirous One,‚Äù in the Ornament of Reason, a commentary on the Root of the Middle Way.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin can dag ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin can dag ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe aggregates, constituents, and sources, which have the nature of the conditioned, do exist,

original: de dag gi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their conditioned characteristics, such as arising, exist.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag gsum po 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dge slong dag gsum po 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag ste /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said, ‚ÄúMonks, these three are the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon /
analyzed: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon /
translated: The conditioned is seen to arise,

original: 'jig par yang mngon te /
analyzed: 'jig par yang mngon te /
translated: it is seen to disintegrate,

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur bar yang mngon no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur bar yang mngon no zhes gsungs so //
translated: and it is seen to remain and change.‚Äù

original: med pa la ni ri bong gi rva ltar skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa la ni ri bong gi rva ltar skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the nonexistent, like the horn of a rabbit, characteristics such as arising do not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nye bar bstan pa las phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nye bar bstan pa las phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since the characteristics of conditioned phenomena are taught, the aggregates, elements, and faculties do exist.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gal te khyod kyi lugs ltar skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi lugs ltar skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod na ni /
translated: If, according to your system, the characteristics of arising and so on exist,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin can dag yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin can dag yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then the aggregates, elements, and faculties, which are the nature of conditioned phenomena, would exist.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not exist.

original: 'dir skye ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa na /üîΩ'dus byas zhig gam 'du @49a * //
analyzed: 'dir skye ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa na / 'dus byas zhig gam 'du @49a * //
translated: Here, if arising is asserted to be the characteristic of conditioned phenomena,

original: ma byas zhig de'i mtshan nyid du 'dod grang na /
analyzed: ma byas zhig de'i mtshan nyid du 'dod grang na /
translated: is it conditioned or unconditioned that is asserted to be its characteristic?

original: de la / gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: de la / gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising is conditioned,

original: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gsum ldan 'gyur //
translated: then it would have three characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid gsum gyi tshogs ni mtshan nyid gsum mo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum gyi tshogs ni mtshan nyid gsum mo //
translated: The collection of three characteristics is called ‚Äúthree characteristics.‚Äù

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas su rtog na ni /
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas su rtog na ni /
translated: If arising is conceived to be conditioned,

original: des na skye ba la yang mtshan nyid gsum yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na skye ba la yang mtshan nyid gsum yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that arising would have three characteristics.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i tshogs kyi rang bzhin 'di ni 'dus byas thams cad la mi 'khrul ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i tshogs kyi rang bzhin 'di ni 'dus byas thams cad la mi 'khrul ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the collection of arising, enduring, and disintegrating is unmistaken with regard to all conditioned phenomena.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du skye bar mtshan gzhi nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du skye bar mtshan gzhi nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, like form and so on, arising would be the basis of the definition,

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but it would not be the characteristic of conditioned phenomena.

original: ci ste skye ba la mtshan nyid gsum mi 'dod na ni /
analyzed: ci ste skye ba la mtshan nyid gsum mi 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you do not assert that arising has three characteristics,

original: de'i tshe mtshan nyid gsum pa dang bral ba'i phyir de 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan nyid gsum pa dang bral ba'i phyir de 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be undermined as a characteristic of conditioned phenomena because it would be devoid of three characteristics.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bshad pa ni /üîΩci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bshad pa ni / ci ste skye ba 'dus ma byas //
translated: It would be like space.üîΩIf arising is unconditioned,

original: ji ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas mtshan nyid yin //
translated: how could it be a characteristic of conditioned phenomena?

original: zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is meant.

original: gzhan yang / skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du rtog pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du rtog pa na /
translated: Moreover, when you imagine that these arising and so on are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena,

original: so so ba ste re re ba zhig gam /
analyzed: so so ba ste re re ba zhig gam /
translated: If you imagine that the characteristics areüîΩindividually, one by one, or

original: 'dus pa ste lhan cig pa zhig mtshan nyid du rtog pa zhig na /
analyzed: 'dus pa ste lhan cig pa zhig mtshan nyid du rtog pa zhig na /
translated: collectively,

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi rung ngo zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi rung ngo zhes bshad pa /
translated: both are untenable.

original: skye la sogs gsum so so yis //
analyzed: skye la sogs gsum so so yis //
translated: It is untenable that the three, arising and so on,

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid bya bar ni //üîΩnus min gcig la dus gcig tu //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid bya bar ni // nus min gcig la dus gcig tu //
translated: individually characterize the produced.üîΩHow could they collectively

original: 'dus pa yang ni ji ltar rung //
analyzed: 'dus pa yang ni ji ltar rung //
translated: characterize it at one time?

original: de la so so ba dag gis ni mtshan nyid bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la so so ba dag gis ni mtshan nyid bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that the three, arising and so on, individually characterize the produced.

original: gal te skye ba'i dus na gnas pa dang 'jig pa med na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i dus na gnas pa dang 'jig pa med na //
translated: If at the time of arising, enduring and ceasing do not exist,

original: de'i tshe nam mkha' ltar gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang bral ba la skye ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'thad pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe nam mkha' ltar gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang bral ba la skye ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du 'thad pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: then, like space, it would be devoid of enduring and ceasing. It is not tenable that arising is the characteristic of the produced.

original: ci ste gnas pa'i dus na skye ba dang 'jig pa dag med na ni de'i tshe de dag dang bral ba la gnas pa yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste gnas pa'i dus na skye ba dang 'jig pa dag med na ni de'i tshe de dag dang bral ba la gnas pa yod par 'gyur na /
translated: But if at the time of enduring, arising and ceasing do not exist, then at that time, it would endure devoid of them.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'i dngos po ni yod pa yin pas /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba'i dngos po ni yod pa yin pas /
translated: But since an entity devoid of arising and ceasing does not exist,

original: nam mkha'i me tog ltar med pa 'di la gnas pa yod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ltar med pa 'di la gnas pa yod par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that this, which is like a sky flower, has endurance.

original: gzhan yang gnas pa dang ldan pa ni phyis mi rtag pa nyid dang yang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnas pa dang ldan pa ni phyis mi rtag pa nyid dang yang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that which is associated with endurance would not later be associated with impermanence,

original: de dang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be associated with a property that is incompatible with that.

original: ci ste sngar rtag par gyur pa las phyis mi rtag par 'gyur ro snyam na //
analyzed: ci ste sngar rtag par gyur pa las phyis mi rtag par 'gyur ro snyam na //
translated: But if you think that it is permanent at first and later becomes impermanent,

original: dngos po gcig @49b rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang ldan par ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po gcig @49b rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang ldan par ni mi rigs so //
translated: it is not reasonable that a single thing is associated with permanence and impermanence.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba la gnas pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba la gnas pa med do //
translated: Therefore, that which is free from arising and destruction does not have endurance.

original: de bzhin du 'jig pa'i dus na gnas pa dang skye ba med na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig pa'i dus na gnas pa dang skye ba med na /
translated: Similarly, if endurance and arising do not exist at the time of destruction,

original: de lta na yang skye ba med cing gnas pa dang bral ba 'di la 'jig pa yang yod pa ma yin te nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang skye ba med cing gnas pa dang bral ba 'di la 'jig pa yang yod pa ma yin te nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: then even though it is like that, destruction does not exist for that which is free from arising and endurance, like a sky flower.

original: de ltar na re zhig skye ba la sogs pa gsum po so so ba dag gis mtshan nyid kyi bya ba nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig skye ba la sogs pa gsum po so so ba dag gis mtshan nyid kyi bya ba nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the three, arising and so on, individually do not have the ability to perform the action of characteristic.

original: nus pa ma yin pa ni mthu yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa ma yin pa ni mthu yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is not able is not powerful.

original: da ni 'dus pa dag kyang mi rung ngo zhes bshad pa /üîΩgcig la dus gcig tu /
analyzed: da ni 'dus pa dag kyang mi rung ngo zhes bshad pa / gcig la dus gcig tu /
translated: Now, it is said that even the collection is not tenable:üîΩHow could the collection

original: 'dus pa yang ni ji ltar rung //
analyzed: 'dus pa yang ni ji ltar rung //
translated: of the momentary be tenable?

original: dngos po gcig pa dus gcig tu 'dod chags dang chags pa dang bral ba bzhin nam snang ba dang mun pa ltar phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig pa dus gcig tu 'dod chags dang chags pa dang bral ba bzhin nam snang ba dang mun pa ltar phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that a single entity is the collection of the momentary, just as it is not tenable that a single entity is both desirous and free from desire, or that a single entity is both light and dark.

original: skad cig gang kho na la dngos po skye bar 'gyur ba'i skad cig de kho na la gnas pa dang 'jig pa yin no zhes sems dang bcas pa su zhig gis rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig gang kho na la dngos po skye bar 'gyur ba'i skad cig de kho na la gnas pa dang 'jig pa yin no zhes sems dang bcas pa su zhig gis rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: What sensible person would understand that the entity that arises in a particular moment also endures and is destroyed in that same moment?

original: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa 'dus pa rnams la yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi bya ba la mthu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa 'dus pa rnams la yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi bya ba la mthu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even the collection of arising, etc., does not have the power to perform the action of the characteristics of conditioned entities.üîΩHere, it is said:

original: 'dir / gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: 'dir / gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising were conditioned,

original: zhes gang brjod pa de la /
analyzed: zhes gang brjod pa de la /
translated: then that which is beingüîΩarisen would have two natures.

original: gal te skye ba la sogs pa rnams la mtshan nyid gsum yod par 'gyur zhing thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la sogs pa rnams la mtshan nyid gsum yod par 'gyur zhing thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: that they would have an infinite regress of characteristics.

original: de las nyes pa cir 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las nyes pa cir 'gyur la /
translated: What is the fault if that is so?

original: de ste 'dus ma byas pa yin pa de lta na yang nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de ste 'dus ma byas pa yin pa de lta na yang nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: And if they are unconditioned, what is the fault if that is so?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: skye dang gnas dang 'jig rnams la //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig rnams la //
translated: Arising, enduring, and ceasing

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid gzhan zhig ni //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid gzhan zhig ni //
translated: If they have other characteristics of conditioned phenomena,

original: gal te yod na thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te yod na thug med 'gyur //
translated: there would be an infinite regress.

original: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
analyzed: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
translated: If they do not, they would not be conditioned.

original: gal te phyogs gnyi ga la yang nyes pa brjod zin pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gnyi ga la yang nyes pa brjod zin pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But haven‚Äôt the faults already been stated for both positions?

original: de la zlos bu brjod pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la zlos bu brjod pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the point of repeating them?

original: nyes pa brjod pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: nyes pa brjod pa bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that the faults have been stated.

original: de slob dpon gyis gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de slob dpon gyis gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they were not stated by the master .

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'grel pa mkhan gyis yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa mkhan gyis yin no //
translated: They were stated by the author of the commentary.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sngar dam bcas pa kho na skyon gzhan brjod pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis slar gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sngar dam bcas pa kho na skyon gzhan brjod pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis slar gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In another way, the Master again states this in order to clarify the previously stated thesis by way of stating other faults.

original: gal te skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa rnams la skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan 'dod na ni /üîΩde'i tshe de dag la yang gzhan yin pas mtha' @50a * //
analyzed: gal te skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa rnams la skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gzhan 'dod na ni / de'i tshe de dag la yang gzhan yin pas mtha' @50a * //
translated: If arising, enduring, and ceasing have other characteristics of conditioned phenomena, such as arising,

original: thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that case, since they would have other characteristics, the error of infinite regress would ensue.

original: thug pa med pa'i skyon du gyur na yang /üîΩgang la dus phyi mar gzhan du 'gyur ba /
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i skyon du gyur na yang / gang la dus phyi mar gzhan du 'gyur ba /
translated: Even if the error of infinite regress does not ensue,üîΩwhat would exist prior to that which becomes other at a later time?

original: snga ma ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: snga ma ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
translated: What would exist prior to that which becomes other at a later time?

original: de'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa med pas skye ba la sogs pa rnams mi srid pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa med pas skye ba la sogs pa rnams mi srid pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since they are not established, arising and so on are impossible.

original: yang na sngar ni mi gtso bo yin pas skye ba kho na la sun 'byin pa brjod la /
analyzed: yang na sngar ni mi gtso bo yin pas skye ba kho na la sun 'byin pa brjod la /
translated: Or, previously he stated refutations of arising alone because it is the most important.

original: da lta ni thun mong du yin no //
analyzed: da lta ni thun mong du yin no //
translated: Now he states them in common.

original: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
analyzed: med na de dag 'dus byas min //
translated: If they do not exist, they are not conditioned.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of this is easily understood.

original: 'dir mang pos bkur ba dag / skye ba la sogs pa rnams la skye ba la sogs pa dag yod la /
analyzed: 'dir mang pos bkur ba dag / skye ba la sogs pa rnams la skye ba la sogs pa dag yod la /
translated: Here, the Sa·πÉmitƒ´yas say: Arising and so on exist for arising and so on.

original: thug pa med par thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And it is not the case that there is an infinite regress,

original: mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams phan tshun sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams phan tshun sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristics and the characteristics of those characteristics mutually establish each other.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir /
translated: Because in this regard

original: 'dus byas kyi chos dge ba 'am nyon mongs pa can zhig skye ba na /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos dge ba 'am nyon mongs pa can zhig skye ba na /
translated: when a virtuous or afflicted conditioned phenomenon arises,

original: bdag nyid dang bco lnga skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag nyid dang bco lnga skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: fifteen things arise together with it.

original: chos de nyid dang / de'i skye ba dang / ldan pa dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / gal te chos de nyon mongs pa can zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: chos de nyid dang / de'i skye ba dang / ldan pa dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / gal te chos de nyon mongs pa can zhig yin na ni /
translated: That phenomenon itself, its arising, its possessing, its enduring, its aging, and its impermanence arise. If that phenomenon is afflicted,

original: de'i log pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / 'on te dge ba zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: de'i log pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / 'on te dge ba zhig yin na ni /
translated: its wrong liberation and its wrong knowledge also arise.

original: de'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / gal te nges par 'byung ba zhig yin na ni de'i nges par 'byung ba nyid dang / de ste nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa zhig yin na ni /üîΩde'i nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / gal te nges par 'byung ba zhig yin na ni de'i nges par 'byung ba nyid dang / de ste nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa zhig yin na ni / de'i nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: If it is a going forth, then its going forth; if it is not a going forth, then its not going forth.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni 'khor yin no //üîΩde nas gzhan skye ba'i skye ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni 'khor yin no // de nas gzhan skye ba'i skye ba nas /
translated: Thus these are the retinue.

original: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar 'di dag ni 'khor gyi 'khor yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar 'di dag ni 'khor gyi 'khor yin no //
translated: Then, the other, the birth of birth, up to the not going forth of the not going forth are the retinue of the retinue.

original: de dag rtsa ba'i skye ba gang yin pa des ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos gzhan bcu bzhi skyed par byed la /
analyzed: de dag rtsa ba'i skye ba gang yin pa des ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos gzhan bcu bzhi skyed par byed la /
translated: That which is the root birth generates fourteen other dharmas, excluding itself.

original: skye ba'i skye ba'i ming can mthun pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i skyes pas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba kho na skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba'i ming can mthun pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i skyes pas ni rtsa ba'i skye ba kho na skyed par byed do //
translated: The birth called the birth of birth, which is a homogeneous characteristic, generates only the root birth.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis ni tshes bcu bzhi nges par 'byung bar mi byed de /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis ni tshes bcu bzhi nges par 'byung bar mi byed de /
translated: Since they are not definite deliverances, they do not cause the definite deliverance of the fourteenth day.

original: de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi byed de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi byed de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They do not cause the attainment of nirvana.

original: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa de kho na nges par 'byung bar mi byed do zhes bya ba'i @50b bar du yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa de kho na nges par 'byung bar mi byed do zhes bya ba'i @50b bar du yin no //
translated: Since they are not definite deliverances, they do not cause the definite deliverance of that which is not a definite deliverance.

original: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi thug pa med pa spang ba'i phyir /üîΩskye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi thug pa med pa spang ba'i phyir / skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba yi //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate the infinite regress of arising, etc.,üîΩthe root arising

original: skye ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed //üîΩrtsa ba'i skye bas skye ba yi //
analyzed: skye ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed // rtsa ba'i skye bas skye ba yi //
translated: is generated by the arising of arising.üîΩThe root arising

original: skye ba'ang skyed par byed pa yin //üîΩzhes smras so //
analyzed: skye ba'ang skyed par byed pa yin // zhes smras so //
translated: generates the arising of arising.

original: skye ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: skye ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Arising is of two types:

original: gcig ni rtsa ba'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: gcig ni rtsa ba'i skye ba'o //
translated: one is root arising;

original: gzhan ni skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the other is called the arising of arising.

original: skye ba'i skye ba ni skye ba'i skye ba'o zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba ni skye ba'i skye ba'o zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the arising of arising is the arising of arising.

original: de la gang skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba'i skye ba des ni rtsa ba'i skye ba 'ba' zhig gi skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gang skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba'i skye ba des ni rtsa ba'i skye ba 'ba' zhig gi skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: In that regard, the arising called the arising of arising causes the generation of the primary arising alone.

original: de nas skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya'i skye ba de ni rtsa ba'i skye bas skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya'i skye ba de ni rtsa ba'i skye bas skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Then the arising called the arising of the arising of arising is generated by the primary arising.

original: de'i phyir de ltar phan tshun sgrub par byed pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa rnams la mtshan nyid gsum po yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar phan tshun sgrub par byed pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa rnams la mtshan nyid gsum po yod pa yin la /
translated: Thus, because they mutually establish each other, arising and so on have three characteristics.

original: thug pa med par thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba'o //
translated: And it is not the case that an infinite regress would ensue.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /üîΩgal te khyod kyi skye ba'i skyes //
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste / gal te khyod kyi skye ba'i skyes //
translated: But this should be said to him:üîΩIf your arising of arising

original: rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed byed na //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed byed na //
translated: Causes the generation of the primary arising,

original: khyod kyi rtsa bas ma bskyed des /
analyzed: khyod kyi rtsa bas ma bskyed des /
translated: Then that which is not generated by your primary

original: de ni ji ltar skyed par byed //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar skyed par byed //
translated: How could it generate the primary?

original: gal te skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba khyod kyi lugs yin na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba khyod kyi lugs yin na /
translated: But if it is your system that the arising of arising gives rise to the basic arising,

original: de ni rtsa ba'i skye bas ma bskyed par gyur ba'i skye pa'i skye ba des ji ltar rtsa ba skyed par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de ni rtsa ba'i skye bas ma bskyed par gyur ba'i skye pa'i skye ba des ji ltar rtsa ba skyed par byed pa yin /
translated: then how could the arising of arising, which has not yet been given rise to by the basic arising, give rise to the basic arising?

original: ci ste rtsa ba'i skyes pas bskyed pa'i skye ba'i skye ba kho nas rtsa ba skyed par byed do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste rtsa ba'i skyes pas bskyed pa'i skye ba'i skye ba kho nas rtsa ba skyed par byed do snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that the arising of arising, which is given rise to by the basic arising, gives rise to the basic arising,

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: then this is also not tenable, as is explained in the following:

original: gal te khyod kyi rtsa ba yis //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi rtsa ba yis //
translated: If the basic arising

original: bskyed pa de yis rtsa bskyed na //üîΩdes ma bskyed pa'i rtsa ba des //
analyzed: bskyed pa de yis rtsa bskyed na // des ma bskyed pa'i rtsa ba des //
translated: Gives rise to that arising of arising,üîΩHow could the basic arising,

original: de ni ji ltar skyed par byed //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar skyed par byed //
translated: Which is not given rise to by that, give rise to it?

original: gal te skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba'i skye ba rtsa bas bskyed pa des rtsa ba skyed bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba'i skye ba rtsa bas bskyed pa des rtsa ba skyed bar byed na /
translated: If the arising called the arising of arising, which is given rise to by the basic arising, gives rise to the basic arising,

original: des ma bskyed cing yod pa ma yin pa'i rtsa ba'i skye ba des ji ltar skye ba'i skye ba skyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: des ma bskyed cing yod pa ma yin pa'i rtsa ba'i skye ba des ji ltar skye ba'i skye ba skyed par 'gyur /
translated: how could the basic arising, which is not given rise to by it and does not exist, give rise to the arising of arising?

original: de'i phyir rtsa bas bskyed par ma gyur pa'i skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsa bas bskyed par ma gyur pa'i skye ba'i skye bas rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say that arising arising, which does not arise from the root, gives rise to the root.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal bar de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because they do not mutually establish each other, the error of infinite regress would ensue.

original: de'i phyir skye ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore arising does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: rtsa ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa nyid kyis skye ba'i skye ba skyed par byed la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa nyid kyis skye ba'i skye ba skyed par byed la /
translated: Arising arising gives rise to the root arising because it is in the process of arising.

original: skye ba'i skye ba de nyid kyis rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba de nyid kyis rtsa ba'i skye ba skyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And that arising arising gives rise to the root arising.

original: gal te / de ma skyes pa de yis ni //
analyzed: gal te / de ma skyes pa de yis ni //
translated: If that which has not arisen

original: de skyed par ni byed nus na //
analyzed: de skyed par ni byed nus na //
translated: could give rise to that,

original: @51a * // khyod kyi skye bzhin pa de yis //
analyzed: @51a * // khyod kyi skye bzhin pa de yis //
translated: then that which is in the process of arisingüîΩwould have to be given rise to by that.

original: de bskyed par ni 'dod la rag / gal te rang nyid ma skyes pas ma skyes pa gzhan bskyed par nus na ni /
analyzed: de bskyed par ni 'dod la rag / gal te rang nyid ma skyes pas ma skyes pa gzhan bskyed par nus na ni /
translated: If that which has not arisen could give rise to that which has not arisen,üîΩthen that which is in the process of arising would have to be given rise to by that.

original: rtsa ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa des skye ba'i skye ba bskyed par 'dod la rag pa zhig na /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skye ba skye bzhin pa des skye ba'i skye ba bskyed par 'dod la rag pa zhig na /
translated: You may think that the arising of arising itself gives rise to the arising of arising,

original: skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: but that which is called ‚Äúarising‚Äù is future,

original: de yang ma skyes pa yin pas ji ltar gzhan skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang ma skyes pa yin pas ji ltar gzhan skyed par 'gyur te /
translated: and since that is unarisen, how could it give rise to another?

original: 'di ni mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: skye ba'i skye ba la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The arising of arising should be explained in the same way.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gang las thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang las thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba /
translated: The consequence of an infinite regress does not follow,

original: skye ba la ni skye ba gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba la ni skye ba gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: because the arising of arising does not exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩji ltar mar me rang dang gzhan //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / ji ltar mar me rang dang gzhan //
translated: What then?üîΩJust as a flame

original: snang bar byed pa de bzhin du //üîΩskye ba'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
analyzed: snang bar byed pa de bzhin du // skye ba'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
translated: illuminates itself and others,üîΩso too arising

original: gnyi ga skyed par byed pa yin //üîΩji ltar mar me snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga skyed par byed pa yin // ji ltar mar me snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: gives rise to itself and others.üîΩJust as a flame, because of its nature of illumination,üîΩilluminates itself and a pot,

original: bdag nyid dang bum pa snang bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag nyid dang bum pa snang bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: so too

original: skye ba yang skye ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba yang skye ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, since arising has the nature of arising,

original: bdag nyid dang gzhan nyid bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang gzhan nyid bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would generate itself and other things.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar byed na ni /
translated: If a lamp illuminates itself and other things,

original: 'di de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then this would be so.

original: byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it does not illuminate itself,

original: 'di ltar / mar me dang ni gang dag na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mar me dang ni gang dag na //
translated: because:

original: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
analyzed: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
translated: A lamp does not illuminateüîΩitself or other things.

original: mar mes ci zhig snang bar byed //
analyzed: mar mes ci zhig snang bar byed //
translated: What does a lamp illuminate?

original: mun pa sel bas snang byed yin //
analyzed: mun pa sel bas snang byed yin //
translated: It is a light because it dispels darkness.

original: 'dir snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni mun pa sel bas yin na /
analyzed: 'dir snang bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni mun pa sel bas yin na /
translated: Here, that which is called ‚Äúillumination‚Äù is the dispelling of darkness.

original: mun pa gang sel bar byed pas rang gi bdag nyid snang bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mun pa gang sel bar byed pas rang gi bdag nyid snang bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur ba /
translated: That which dispels darkness would illuminate itself.

original: re zhig mar me'i rang gi bdag nyid la ni mun pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig mar me'i rang gi bdag nyid la ni mun pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But darkness does not exist for a lamp‚Äôs own nature,

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are incompatible.

original: mun pa rang gang sel bar byed bas mar me la gzhan snang bar byed pa nyid yod par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mun pa rang gang sel bar byed bas mar me la gzhan snang bar byed pa nyid yod par 'gyur ba /
translated: That which dispels darkness would illuminate other things.

original: yul gang na mar me 'dug pa de na yang mun pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gang na mar me 'dug pa de na yang mun pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And where the butterlamp exists, there darkness does not exist.

original: de'i phyir / mar me la rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar byed pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mar me la rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar byed pa nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, the butterlamp does not illuminate either itself or others.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar yin pa de'i tshe mar me bzhin du skye ba la rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid skyed par byed pa nyid yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar yin pa de'i tshe mar me bzhin du skye ba la rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid skyed par byed pa nyid yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since this is so, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúJust as the butterlamp illuminates itself and others, so too arising gives rise to itself and others.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: mar me dang ni gang dag na //
analyzed: mar me dang ni gang dag na //
translated: Where the butterlamp is

original: de 'dug pa na mun @51b pa med //üîΩces gang smras pa de ni mun pa bsal ba med na /
analyzed: de 'dug pa na mun @51b pa med // ces gang smras pa de ni mun pa bsal ba med na /
translated: There is no darkness.üîΩIf darkness is not dispelled,

original: de ltar brjod par mi rigs pa zhig ste /
analyzed: de ltar brjod par mi rigs pa zhig ste /
translated: It is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúWhere the butterlamp is, there is no darkness.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: skye bzhin pa'i mar me nyid kyis mun pa bsal ba yin te /üîΩde'i phyir mar me la mun pa med cing /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i mar me nyid kyis mun pa bsal ba yin te / de'i phyir mar me la mun pa med cing /
translated: the butterlamp itself dispels darkness as it arises.

original: gang na mar me yod pa de na yang mun pa med do zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang na mar me yod pa de na yang mun pa med do zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is tenable to say, ‚ÄúThe butterlamp does not illuminate darkness, and where the butterlamp exists, there darkness does not exist.‚Äù

original: gal te mar mes mun pa bsal bar ma byas par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te mar mes mun pa bsal bar ma byas par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the light did not dispel darkness,

original: de'i tshe mar me mi 'bar ba de bzhin du 'bar ba na yang /
analyzed: de'i tshe mar me mi 'bar ba de bzhin du 'bar ba na yang /
translated: then just as it is when the light is not burning,

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: so too when it is burning, the pot and so on would not be seen,

original: sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin du mun pa bsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin du mun pa bsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the darkness would not be dispelled, as before.

original: de'i phyir mar me la mun pa sel ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi snang bar byed pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mar me la mun pa sel ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi snang bar byed pa yod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the light has the characteristic of dispelling darkness, and

original: de yang mar me skye bzhin pa 'dis byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mar me skye bzhin pa 'dis byas pa yin no //
translated: that is produced by the arising of the light.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gang tshe mar me skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: gang tshe mar me skye bzhin pa //
translated: When the light is arising

original: mun pa dang ni phrad med na //
analyzed: mun pa dang ni phrad med na //
translated: it does not contact darkness.

original: ji ltar mar me skye bzhin pas //
analyzed: ji ltar mar me skye bzhin pas //
translated: How then does the arising light

original: mun pa sel bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: mun pa sel bar byed pa yin //
translated: dispel darkness?

original: 'dir snang ba dang mun pa gnyis la cig car ba nyid med pa'i phyir phrad pa med la /
analyzed: 'dir snang ba dang mun pa gnyis la cig car ba nyid med pa'i phyir phrad pa med la /
translated: Here, because light and darkness do not occur simultaneously, they do not contact each other.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar phrad pa med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar phrad pa med pa de'i tshe /
translated: When they do not contact each other,

original: de ni ji ltar de rnam la gang gis mar me skye bzhin pas mun pa sel lo zhes brtag par rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar de rnam la gang gis mar me skye bzhin pas mun pa sel lo zhes brtag par rigs par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be tenable to say that darkness is cleared away by a lamp that is arising and has not yet come into contact with it?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar mar me skye bzhin pa mun pa dang phrad pa med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar mar me skye bzhin pa mun pa dang phrad pa med la /
translated: Because in this way a lamp that is arising does not come into contact with darkness,

original: phrad pa med pa de'i phyir mar mes cung zad kyang snang bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar nges par bya'o //
analyzed: phrad pa med pa de'i phyir mar mes cung zad kyang snang bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar nges par bya'o //
translated: and because it does not come into contact with it, it is certain that a lamp does not illuminate even the slightest bit.

original: ci ste ye shes kyis ma rig pa ma phrad pa kho na 'joms pa dang / mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa nyid mthong ba dang / nor bu khab len gyis lcags ma phrad pa kho na 'dren par byed pa de bzhin du mar mes ma phrad pa'i mun pa sel bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste ye shes kyis ma rig pa ma phrad pa kho na 'joms pa dang / mig gis gzugs ma phrad pa nyid mthong ba dang / nor bu khab len gyis lcags ma phrad pa kho na 'dren par byed pa de bzhin du mar mes ma phrad pa'i mun pa sel bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that just as wisdom eliminates ignorance without coming into contact with it, the eye sees form without coming into contact with it, and a magnet attracts a piece of metal without coming into contact with it, in the same way a lamp clears away darkness without coming into contact with it,

original: 'di yang snying po med do zhes bshad pa /üîΩmar me phrad pa med par yang //
analyzed: 'di yang snying po med do zhes bshad pa / mar me phrad pa med par yang //
translated: then this is also pointless, as the following explains.üîΩIf a lamp clears away darkness

original: gal te mun pa sel byed na //
analyzed: gal te mun pa sel byed na //
translated: Without coming into contact with it,

original: 'jig rten kun na gnas pa'i mun //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun na gnas pa'i mun //
translated: Then the darkness that pervades the entire world

original: 'di na gnas pa des bsal 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di na gnas pa des bsal 'gyur //
translated: Would be cleared away by the lamp here.

original: gal te mar mes phrad pa med par mun pa sel na ni /
analyzed: gal te mar mes phrad pa med par mun pa sel na ni /
translated: If a lamp clears darkness without contacting it,

original: de lta yin dang 'di na gnas pa'i mar mes 'jig rten no cog na gnas pa'i mun pa sel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'di na gnas pa'i mar mes 'jig rten no cog na gnas pa'i mun pa sel bar 'gyur te /
translated: then a lamp here would clear the darkness of the entire world.

original: ma phrad pa'i phyir nye ba na gnas pa bzhin na snyam du dgongs so //üîΩtshul 'dis ni ye shes @52a * //
analyzed: ma phrad pa'i phyir nye ba na gnas pa bzhin na snyam du dgongs so // tshul 'dis ni ye shes @52a * //
translated: Because it would not contact it, it would be as if it were near.üîΩBy this method,

original: kyis ma rig pa 'joms shing /
analyzed: kyis ma rig pa 'joms shing /
translated: wisdom destroys ignorance,

original: mig gis gzugs mthong la /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs mthong la /
translated: the eye sees visible form,üîΩand a magnet attracts iron.

original: nor bu khab len gyis lcags 'dren no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yang bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nor bu khab len gyis lcags 'dren no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yang bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is similar to what is to be established.

original: ci ste ma phrad pa yin yang nor bu khab len pa la sogs pa rung ba'i yul na gnas pa rnams kho nas rang gi 'bras bu byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste ma phrad pa yin yang nor bu khab len pa la sogs pa rung ba'i yul na gnas pa rnams kho nas rang gi 'bras bu byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is not contacted, then only those that are in a suitable place, such as a magnet, would produce their effect.

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: That is also not tenable.

original: ma phrad pa yin na ni /
analyzed: ma phrad pa yin na ni /
translated: If it is not contacted,

original: yul gzhan thag ring ba na gnas pa dang / bar du chod pa'i yul gzhan gnas pa gzhan du ma phrad pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: yul gzhan thag ring ba na gnas pa dang / bar du chod pa'i yul gzhan gnas pa gzhan du ma phrad pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because objects that are distant or that are obstructed by other objects do not contact each other.

original: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa rnams kyis rung ba'i yul na gnas pa nyid mi rigs pas rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i sgo nas rang gi 'bras bu byed pa nyid kyang gang las 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: rung ba'i yul na gnas pa rnams kyis rung ba'i yul na gnas pa nyid mi rigs pas rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i sgo nas rang gi 'bras bu byed pa nyid kyang gang las 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: Since it is illogical for objects that are suitable to be in a suitable place, how could they produce their own effects by being in a suitable place?

original: gal te 'jig rten du mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten du mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that you see this in the world,

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: ji ltar khyod rtog par byed pa de ltar ni 'jig rten du ma mthong ngo //üîΩ'di ltar 'jig rten du ni de lta bu'i yul la sogs pa la phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i dpyad ra bcug nas /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod rtog par byed pa de ltar ni 'jig rten du ma mthong ngo // 'di ltar 'jig rten du ni de lta bu'i yul la sogs pa la phrad pa dang ma phrad pa'i dpyad ra bcug nas /
translated: The world does not see things as you imagine.üîΩThe world does not analyze whether or not a lamp and so on makes contact with the object it illuminates and so on.

original: mar me la sogs pa rnams la snang bar byed pa nyid la sogs pa rtog par mi byed de /
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa rnams la snang bar byed pa nyid la sogs pa rtog par mi byed de /
translated: The world does not imagine that a lamp and so on illuminates itself and others.

original: ji skad brjod pa'i rnam par dpyad pa mi 'jug par mar mes mun pa sel ba dang mig gis gzugs mthong ba dang / nor bu khab len gyis lcags 'dren no zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i rnam par dpyad pa mi 'jug par mar mes mun pa sel ba dang mig gis gzugs mthong ba dang / nor bu khab len gyis lcags 'dren no zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The world does not investigate in the way that has been analyzed, but it does assert that a lamp clears darkness, that the eye sees form, that a magnet attracts iron, and so on.

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis ji skad smras pa de ltar 'jig rten du ma mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis ji skad smras pa de ltar 'jig rten du ma mthong ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the world does not see things in the way that you describe.

original: yang na 'jig rten gyis de ltar mthong mod /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyis de ltar mthong mod /
translated: Or, if the world does see things in that way,

original: de kho na rnam par dpyod pa'i dus su 'jig rten tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir des gnod par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: de kho na rnam par dpyod pa'i dus su 'jig rten tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir des gnod par byed mi nus so //
translated: then when one analyzes reality, the world cannot invalidate it.

original: de ltar na re zhig ma phrad par snang bar byed pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig ma phrad par snang bar byed pa mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that light illuminates without contact.

original: yul la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni phrad na /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni phrad na /
translated: If the object and so on are apprehended through contact,

original: yang mi rigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang mi rigs pa nyid de /
translated: then that is also untenable.

original: phrad pa ni gcig nyid yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: phrad pa ni gcig nyid yin par 'gyur la /
translated: Because contact would entail oneness.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: When that is so,

original: gcig nyid yin pa de'i tshe ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du mthong ba dang 'dren pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin pa de'i tshe ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du mthong ba dang 'dren pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is one, then like its own nature, seeing, drawing, and so on do not exist.

original: gal te yang 'thad pa dang bral ba nyid kyis 'di brdzun pa'i don can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te yang 'thad pa dang bral ba nyid kyis 'di brdzun pa'i don can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you think that because this is untenable, it is meaningless,

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la phrad pa dang ma phrad pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'di mi 'jug mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la phrad pa dang ma phrad pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa 'di mi 'jug mod kyi /
translated: then although this conception of contact, noncontact, and so on does not apply to worldly conventions,

original: de lta na yang don @52b dam par yang 'thad pa dang bral ba'i phyogs khas blangs par 'gyur du 'ong bas de kho na nyid rnam par dpyod pa na gzhug par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang don @52b dam par yang 'thad pa dang bral ba'i phyogs khas blangs par 'gyur du 'ong bas de kho na nyid rnam par dpyod pa na gzhug par bya ba yin no //
translated: still, because it would follow that you accept a position that is untenable even in the ultimate, you should engage in the analysis of reality.

original: spros pas chog go //üîΩgal te mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar byed par rtog na /
analyzed: spros pas chog go // gal te mar me rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid snang bar byed par rtog na /
translated: Enough with this elaboration!üîΩIf you imagine that a lamp illuminates itself and others,

original: 'o na ni gnyen por gyur pa mun pa la yang rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid sgrib par brtag par bya dgos so zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: 'o na ni gnyen por gyur pa mun pa la yang rang dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid sgrib par brtag par bya dgos so zhes bshad pa /
translated: then you should imagine that darkness obscures itself and others, for it is the antithesis of light.

original: mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
analyzed: mar me rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //
translated: A lamp illuminates itself and others.

original: gal te snang bar byed 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te snang bar byed 'gyur na //
translated: If it illuminates itself and others,

original: mun pa'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos //üîΩsgrib par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
analyzed: mun pa'ang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos // sgrib par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
translated: darkness would also obscure itself and others,

original: 'gal zla yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal zla yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the opposite.

original: mar me bzhin du mun pa yang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos por rtogs pa'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar me bzhin du mun pa yang rang dang gzhan gyi dngos por rtogs pa'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a lamp is understood to perform the action of illuminating itself and others, darkness would also obscure itself and others, because it is the opposite of light.

original: de'i phyir gzhan bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just like others,

original: bdag nyid la yang sgrib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la yang sgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would also obscure itself.

original: gal te mun pas bdag nyid sgrib par byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te mun pas bdag nyid sgrib par byed na ni /
translated: If darkness obscured itself,

original: mun pas bsgribs pa'i phyir de nyid kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mun pas bsgribs pa'i phyir de nyid kyang mi dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: it would not be perceived, because it would be obscured by darkness,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just like a pot, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the noble S≈´tra on UpƒÅsaka Precepts it says,

original: shin tu dga' ba'i bstan pa 'di la ni //
analyzed: shin tu dga' ba'i bstan pa 'di la ni //
translated: In this very delightful teaching,üîΩAbandon the marks of a householder and go forth,

original: khyim pa'i rtags spangs rab tu byung gyis dang // 'bras bu yod cing mchog tu 'gyur gyi zhes //
analyzed: khyim pa'i rtags spangs rab tu byung gyis dang // 'bras bu yod cing mchog tu 'gyur gyi zhes //
translated: For it is fruitful and supreme.

original: thugs rje can gyis de skad bstan pa'ang mdzad //
analyzed: thugs rje can gyis de skad bstan pa'ang mdzad //
translated: The compassionate one taught this.

original: khyim pa'i rtags spangs rab tu byung gyur nas //
analyzed: khyim pa'i rtags spangs rab tu byung gyur nas //
translated: Having abandoned the signs of a householder, they become renunciants.

original: 'bras bu thams cad thob par gyur yang ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad thob par gyur yang ni //
translated: Even though they attain all the results,

original: chos kyi rang bzhin dag la gzhal byas nas //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin dag la gzhal byas nas //
translated: having measured the nature of phenomena,

original: 'bras bu kun med 'bras bu thob pa'ang med //
analyzed: 'bras bu kun med 'bras bu thob pa'ang med //
translated: all results do not exist, and there is no attainment of results.

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu thob pa thob 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu thob pa thob 'gyur ba //
translated: Nevertheless, they attain the attainment of the result.

original: kye ma'o mi mchog thugs rje ldan pa yi //
analyzed: kye ma'o mi mchog thugs rje ldan pa yi //
translated: Ah! The compassionate supreme beings,

original: rgyal bas rigs pa shin tu legs bshad ces //
analyzed: rgyal bas rigs pa shin tu legs bshad ces //
translated: the Victorious One has excellently explained the reasoning.

original: de dag ngo mtshar che ba skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag ngo mtshar che ba skye bar 'gyur //
translated: They will give rise to great wonder.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the Noble Mound of Jewels Sutra also says:

original: dper na khyim du mi 'ga' la la yis //
analyzed: dper na khyim du mi 'ga' la la yis //
translated: For example, in a house, by someone

original: yun ring lon nas mar me bus byas na //
analyzed: yun ring lon nas mar me bus byas na //
translated: having lit a lamp for a long time,

original: de la mun pa bdag gnas rang lon gyis //
analyzed: de la mun pa bdag gnas rang lon gyis //
translated: the darkness thinks, ‚ÄúI will stay here myself,

original: 'di nas mi 'gro snyam du sems pa med //
analyzed: 'di nas mi 'gro snyam du sems pa med //
translated: I will not go from here,‚Äù but it does not think this.

original: mar me byung na mun pa mun nag la //
analyzed: mar me byung na mun pa mun nag la //
translated: When the lamp appears, the darkness

original: med par mi 'gyur ba yi nus pa med //
analyzed: med par mi 'gyur ba yi nus pa med //
translated: There is no potential that does not exist.

original: mar me brten nas mun pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mar me brten nas mun pa med par 'gyur //
translated: In dependence on a lamp, darkness does not exist.

original: gnyi ga stong la rlom sems ci yang med //
analyzed: gnyi ga stong la rlom sems ci yang med //
translated: There is no conceit at all in the empty.

original: de bzhin zag med 'phags pa'i @53a * //
analyzed: de bzhin zag med 'phags pa'i @53a * //
translated: In the same way, in dependence on the uncontaminated

original: ye shes brten //üîΩmi shes nyon mongs bsags pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: ye shes brten // mi shes nyon mongs bsags pa med par 'gyur //
translated: gnosis of the ƒÅryas,üîΩthe accumulation of ignorance and afflictions does not exist.

original: ye shes dang ni nyon mongs rtag par yang //
analyzed: ye shes dang ni nyon mongs rtag par yang //
translated: Gnosis and afflictions

original: de dag lan 'ga' tsam yang 'grogs pa med //
analyzed: de dag lan 'ga' tsam yang 'grogs pa med //
translated: never coexist.

original: ye shes mi shes med bya mi sems kyang //
analyzed: ye shes mi shes med bya mi sems kyang //
translated: Although gnosis does not think, ‚ÄúI will eliminate ignorance,‚Äù

original: ye shes brten nas mi shes med par 'gyur //
analyzed: ye shes brten nas mi shes med par 'gyur //
translated: in dependence on gnosis, ignorance does not exist.

original: gnyi ga gzung med nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //üîΩde bzhin ye shes mi shes gnyi ga stong //
analyzed: gnyi ga gzung med nam mkha'i me tog bzhin // de bzhin ye shes mi shes gnyi ga stong //
translated: Both are ungraspable, like a sky flower.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, both gnosis and ignorance are empty.

original: gzhan yang 'dir gal te skye ba 'dis bdag nyid skyed par byed na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir gal te skye ba 'dis bdag nyid skyed par byed na /
translated: Moreover, if this arising causes the generation of itself,

original: de skyes pa zhig gam ma skyes pa zhig gis rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed grang //
analyzed: de skyes pa zhig gam ma skyes pa zhig gis rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed grang //
translated: does it cause the generation of itself through being arisen or unarisen?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa /
translated: It is untenable in both cases.

original: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
analyzed: skye ba 'di ni ma skyes pas //
translated: How could this arising, not having arisen,

original: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar bskyed //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ji ltar bskyed //
translated: give rise to itself?

original: ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
analyzed: ci ste skyes pas skyed byed na //
translated: But if it is arisen that gives rise to itself,

original: skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod //
analyzed: skyes na ci zhig bskyed du yod //
translated: what is there to be given rise to that is arisen?

original: gal te skye ba ma skyes pas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te skye ba ma skyes pas rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed na ni /
translated: If arising, not having arisen, gives rise to itself,

original: nam mkha'i me tog kyang rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog kyang rang gi bdag nyid skyed par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then even a sky flower would give rise to itself.

original: 'on te skyes pas skyed par byed na ni //
analyzed: 'on te skyes pas skyed par byed na ni //
translated: But if it is arisen that gives rise to itself,

original: skyes zin pa la skye ba gzhan gyis dgos pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: skyes zin pa la skye ba gzhan gyis dgos pa ci zhig yod /
translated: what need is there for another arising of that which has already arisen?

original: de ltar re zhig skye bas bdag nyid bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig skye bas bdag nyid bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: In this way, first, arising does not give rise to itself.

original: da ni gzhan yang ji ltar mi skyed pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩskyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: da ni gzhan yang ji ltar mi skyed pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / skyes dang ma skyes skye bzhin pa //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate how it does not give rise to another, it is said:üîΩArising does not give rise to another in any way whatsoever,

original: ci lta bur yang mi skyed pa //
analyzed: ci lta bur yang mi skyed pa //
translated: whether it is arisen, not arisen, or in the process of arising.

original: de ni song dang ma song dang // bgom pas rnam par bshad pa yin //
analyzed: de ni song dang ma song dang // bgom pas rnam par bshad pa yin //
translated: This is explained by ‚Äúgone, not gone, and that being gone over.‚Äù

original: gal te 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur na ni //
translated: If something were to arise,

original: de skye bas skyed par byed pa zhig na /
analyzed: de skye bas skyed par byed pa zhig na /
translated: If it is generated by arising,

original: 'ga' yang skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' yang skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: then nothing at all arises,

original: dus gsum kar yang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum kar yang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no arising in any of the three temporal periods.

original: 'di yang sngar song ba dang ma song ba dang / bgom pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang sngar song ba dang ma song ba dang / bgom pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This has been explained by the gone, not gone, and that being gone over.

original: de la ji ltar song ba la ni 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ji ltar song ba la ni 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, there is no going where one has gone,

original: 'das pa dang da ltar bdag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar bdag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past and the present are mutually exclusive.

original: ma song ba la yang 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma song ba la yang 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: There is no going where one has not gone,

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the future and the present are mutually exclusive.

original: bgom pa la yang 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bgom pa la yang 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: There is no going where one goes,

original: song ba dang ma song ba las ma gtogs pa'i bgom pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: song ba dang ma song ba las ma gtogs pa'i bgom pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa de bzhin du /
translated: because that being gone over is not observed apart from where one has gone and where one has not gone.

original: skyes pa ni mi skye ste /
analyzed: skyes pa ni mi skye ste /
translated: That which has arisen does not arise,

original: 'das pa dang da ltar ba dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar ba dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past and the present are mutually exclusive.

original: skye ba'i bya ba 'gags pa la ni skyes pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: skye ba'i bya ba 'gags pa la ni skyes pa zhes bya la /
translated: That which has ceased to perform the action of arising is called ‚Äúarisen.‚Äù

original: skye ba zhes @53b bya ba ni bya ba dang da ltar bas zin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba zhes @53b bya ba ni bya ba dang da ltar bas zin pa la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù refers to that which is being taken hold of by action and the present.

original: de'i phyir skyes pa skye'o zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes pa skye'o zhes brjod pa na /
translated: Therefore, when it is said that ‚Äúthe arisen arises,‚Äù

original: 'das pa dang da ltar ba gnyis dus gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar ba gnyis dus gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the past and the present would be simultaneous.

original: ma skyes pa yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang mi skye ste /
translated: Also, that which is not arisen does not arise.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the future and the present are mutually exclusive.

original: skye bzhin pa'i dngos po yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i dngos po yang mi skye ste /
translated: Also, an entity that is in the process of arising does not arise.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa las ma gtogs pa'i skye bzhin pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa las ma gtogs pa'i skye bzhin pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apart from the arisen and the non-arisen, that which is in the process of arising does not exist.

original: de'i phyir skye bas gzhan skyed par byed do zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye bas gzhan skyed par byed do zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say that arising causes the generation of another.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: skye bzhin pa kho na skye'i skyes pa dang ma skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa kho na skye'i skyes pa dang ma skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Only that which is in the process of arising arises, not that which has arisen or not arisen.

original: ci ste ma skyes pa dang skyes pa las tha dad par skyes bzhin pa med pa'i phyir skye bzhin pa skye ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste ma skyes pa dang skyes pa las tha dad par skyes bzhin pa med pa'i phyir skye bzhin pa skye ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that that which is in the process of arising does not arise because it is not different from that which is not arisen and that which has arisen,

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then this is also not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir skye ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa la skye bzhin pa zhes bya bar brjod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir skye ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa la skye bzhin pa zhes bya bar brjod de /
translated: Because here that which possesses the action of arising is called that which is arising.

original: de'i phyir skye ba yod dang skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa grub pa'i phyir skye bzhin pa kho na skye la /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba yod dang skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa grub pa'i phyir skye bzhin pa kho na skye la /
translated: Since arising exists and that which is arising is established in dependence on arising, that which is arising alone arises.

original: skye bzhin pa de yang skye bas skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa de yang skye bas skyed par byed do //
translated: And that which is arising is generated by arising.

original: brjod par bya ste /üîΩgang tshe skye ba yod pa na //
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / gang tshe skye ba yod pa na //
translated: We reply:üîΩWhen arising exists,

original: skye bzhin 'di 'byung med pa'i tshe //üîΩji ltar skye la brten nas ni //
analyzed: skye bzhin 'di 'byung med pa'i tshe // ji ltar skye la brten nas ni //
translated: that which is arising does not exist.üîΩHow could you say that which is arising

original: skye bzhin zhes ni brjod par bya //üîΩskye ba la brten nas skye bzhin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: skye bzhin zhes ni brjod par bya // skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin par 'gyur la /
translated: depends on arising?üîΩYou might say that which is arising exists in dependence on arising and that also arises.

original: de yang skye ba yin no zhes gang smras pa des ni 'di'i skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa 'di zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bye brag tu smra bar bya dgos na /
analyzed: de yang skye ba yin no zhes gang smras pa des ni 'di'i skye ba la brten nas skye bzhin pa 'di zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bye brag tu smra bar bya dgos na /
translated: But you should say that which is arising is called that which is arising in dependence on arising.

original: de skad du ni smras pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de skad du ni smras pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But you do not say that.
