original: ji ltar mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan 'das pa ni //
translated: How can nirvana

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yin te //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyis yin te //
translated: Be both a thing and a nonthing?

original: mya ngan 'das la 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das la 'dus ma byas //
translated: Nirvana is unconditioned.

original: dngos dang dngos med 'dus byas yin //üîΩzhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med 'dus byas yin // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: A thing and a nonthing are conditioned.

original: spros pas tshig go //
analyzed: spros pas tshig go //
translated: Elaborations are words.

original: dkyus ma nyid bshad par bya'o //üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid bshad par bya'o // 'dir smras pa /
translated: I will explain the simple truth.üîΩHere, someone might say, ‚ÄúAlthough the arising, enduring, and

original: gal te 'dus byas kyi skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag bkag mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas kyi skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag bkag mod kyi /
translated: ceasing of conditioned phenomena have been refuted, still conditioned

original: de lta na yang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i 'dus byas ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i 'dus byas ni yod pa yin te /
translated: phenomena that have the characteristics of the particularities exist.üîΩThus, solidity and so forth and the dewlap and so forth are taught to be

original: 'di ltar sra ba la sogs pa dang / lkog shal la sogs pa ni de'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sra ba la sogs pa dang / lkog shal la sogs pa ni de'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: the characteristics of the particularities of conditioned phenomena. Therefore,üîΩsince conditioned phenomena exist, their characteristics also exist.‚Äù

original: @60a * // de'i phyir 'dus byas yod pas de'i mtshan nyid kyang yod do //
analyzed: @60a * // de'i phyir 'dus byas yod pas de'i mtshan nyid kyang yod do //
translated: This is to be

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: addressed as follows:

original: gal te 'dus byas nyid yod na //
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas nyid yod na //
translated: If conditioned phenomena exist,

original: de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like that.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa dag / ma grub phyir na 'dus byas med //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skye dang gnas dang 'jig pa dag / ma grub phyir na 'dus byas med //
translated: Since arising, enduring, and ceasing are not established, the conditioned does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag kho na bkag pa de'i tshe 'dus byas ga la yod //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag kho na bkag pa de'i tshe 'dus byas ga la yod //
translated: When arising, enduring, and ceasing are refuted in the manner explained, how could the conditioned exist?

original: de'i phyir de'i khyad par ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i khyad par ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, how could its attributes exist?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: 'dus byas ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: The conditioned exists.

original: de'i gnyen po 'dus ma byas yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po 'dus ma byas yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its antidote, the unconditioned, exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te 'dus ma byas nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus ma byas nyid yod na /
translated: If the unconditioned itself existed,

original: 'di de ltar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di de ltar 'gyur na /
translated: it would be like that.

original: yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: 'dus byas rab tu ma grub pas //
analyzed: 'dus byas rab tu ma grub pas //
translated: Since the conditioned is not established,

original: 'dus ma byas ni ji ltar 'grub //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ji ltar 'grub //
translated: how could the unconditioned be established?

original: 'dir kha cig ni nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnams ni 'dus ma byas yin no zhes rtog par byed la /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig ni nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnams ni 'dus ma byas yin no zhes rtog par byed la /
translated: Here, some imagine that space, nonanalytical cessation, and nirvana are unconditioned.üîΩOthers imagine emptiness, which has the characteristic of thusness, to be unconditioned.

original: gzhan dag ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas su rtog par byed pa de thams cad 'dus byas rab tu ma grub par gyur pas yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid la 'dus ma byas su rtog par byed pa de thams cad 'dus byas rab tu ma grub par gyur pas yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes gsal bar bstan to //
translated: All of these are clearly taught to be nonexistent, since conditioned phenomena are not established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par gzung na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa yod pa ma yin no zhes nges par gzung na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf you insist that arising, enduring, and disintegrating do not exist,

original: 'o na thub pa ye shes sgrib pa med pa mnga' bas /
analyzed: 'o na thub pa ye shes sgrib pa med pa mnga' bas /
translated: then how should one understand the statement by the Sage, who possesses unobstructed wisdom,

original: dge slong dag 'dus byas ni skye bar yang mngon /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dus byas ni skye bar yang mngon /
translated: ‚ÄòMonks, conditioned phenomena are seen to arise,

original: 'jig pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur bar yang mngon no zhes gang gsungs pa de ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur bar yang mngon no zhes gang gsungs pa de ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: to disintegrate, and to transform from abiding‚Äô?üîΩ‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: rmi lam ji bzhin sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: rmi lam ji bzhin sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: Like a dream, like an illusion,

original: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
translated: Like a city of gandharvas,

original: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
translated: So is arising, so is enduring,

original: de bzhin du ni 'jig pa gsungs //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni 'jig pa gsungs //
translated: So is ceasing taught.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa yin yang /üîΩ'jig rten na sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgra'i brjod bya dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rtogs par bya bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin yang 'jig rten la grags pa tsam gyi sgo nas /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa yin yang / 'jig rten na sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sgra'i brjod bya dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rtogs par bya bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin yang 'jig rten la grags pa tsam gyi sgo nas /
translated: Just as illusions and so on, though not intrinsically arisen,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: are the referents of terms such as ‚Äúillusion‚Äù and are the objects of the consciousnesses that perceive illusions and so on, in the same way, though arising and so on do not intrinsically exist, the Transcendent Lord taught them in accordance with what is familiar to the world.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it has been said:

original: lpags rgyus sha rus 'dus la 'di dag @60b gi / chung ma yin snyam 'du shes bskyed nas ni //
analyzed: lpags rgyus sha rus 'dus la 'di dag @60b gi / chung ma yin snyam 'du shes bskyed nas ni //
translated: Having generated the conception that this collection of skin, sinew, flesh, and bones

original: byis pa rmongs rnams 'dod chags skyed byed cing //
analyzed: byis pa rmongs rnams 'dod chags skyed byed cing //
translated: Is a wife, foolish, confused beings generate desire.

original: sgyu ma ji bzhin bud med mi shes so //
analyzed: sgyu ma ji bzhin bud med mi shes so //
translated: They do not understand that women are like illusions.

original: ji ltar bu mo gzhon nu'i rmi lam na //üîΩbu pho byung zhing shi ba des mthong nas //
analyzed: ji ltar bu mo gzhon nu'i rmi lam na // bu pho byung zhing shi ba des mthong nas //
translated: Just as a young girl in a dreamüîΩGives birth to a child, sees it die,

original: byung nas dga' zhing shi nas mi dga' ltar //
analyzed: byung nas dga' zhing shi nas mi dga' ltar //
translated: And then, upon waking, remembers it with sadness,

original: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes par gyis //
translated: So should you understand all phenomena.

original: ji ltar dri za'i grong khyer smig rgyu dang // sgyu ma ji bzhin rmi lam ci 'dra bar //
analyzed: ji ltar dri za'i grong khyer smig rgyu dang // sgyu ma ji bzhin rmi lam ci 'dra bar //
translated: Like a city of gandharvas, a mirage, an illusion, or a dream,

original: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes bya ste //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin shes bya ste //
translated: All phenomena should be understood in this way.

original: mtshan ma sgom pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong //
analyzed: mtshan ma sgom pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong //
translated: The meditation on signs is empty by nature.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And likewise:

original: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas kun dben pa ste //
analyzed: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas kun dben pa ste //
translated: All conditioned and unconditioned things are void,

original: drang srong de dag la ni rnam rtog med //
analyzed: drang srong de dag la ni rnam rtog med //
translated: And those sages have no conceptual thoughts.

original: 'gro ba kun du 'dus ma byas 'thob pas //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun du 'dus ma byas 'thob pas //
translated: Since they attain the unconditioned in all worlds,

original: lta ba dag las khor mor rnam par dben //
analyzed: lta ba dag las khor mor rnam par dben //
translated: They are always free from views.

original: gang dag 'di 'dra'i chos rnams shes pa ni //
analyzed: gang dag 'di 'dra'i chos rnams shes pa ni //
translated: Those who know phenomena in this way

original: rtag tu ma chags mi gtum mi rmongs te //
analyzed: rtag tu ma chags mi gtum mi rmongs te //
translated: Are never attached, aggressive, or ignorant.

original: de yi sems ni rang bzhin mnyam par gzhag / de ni ting 'dzin stobs can stobs dang ldan //üîΩzhes gsungs so //üîΩslob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
analyzed: de yi sems ni rang bzhin mnyam par gzhag / de ni ting 'dzin stobs can stobs dang ldan // zhes gsungs so // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba'i tshig gsal ba las /
translated: He is a powerful one with the power of meditative stabilization.üîΩThis concludes the commentary on the seventh chapter, the ‚ÄúExamination of the Created,‚Äù in the root text of the Treatise on the Middle Way.

original: 'dus byas brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: 'dus byas brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa bdun pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: CHAPTER EIGHT Examination of the Prior Entity

original: // /'dir smras pa /üîΩrnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin can rnams ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin can rnams ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: de'i rgyu las dang byed pa po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las dang byed pa po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThings that are created, such as consciousness, exist essentially because their causes, actions and agents, exist.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Transcendent Lord has said,

original: ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i skyes bu gang zag 'di ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i skyes bu gang zag 'di ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThis person, who is connected with ignorance,üîΩaccumulates merit,üîΩaccumulates demerit,

original: bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: and accumulates unmoving merit.‚Äù

original: bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du bya yang mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas las kyi byed pa po dang / las de dang / 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyang nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba mngon par 'du bya yang mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas las kyi byed pa po dang / las de dang / 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyang nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: and ‚Äúone who is not virtuous and one who is not stable form a compositional activity‚Äù and so on, the agent of action, that action, and the result, consciousness and so on, are also taught.

original: gang la byed pa po yod pa de ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la byed pa po yod pa de ni yod pa yin te /
translated: Whatever has an agent exists.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a pot.

original: gang zhig byed pa med pa de la ni byed pa po med de /
analyzed: gang zhig byed pa med pa de la ni byed pa po med de /
translated: Whatever does not have an agent does not exist.

original: dper na rus sbal gyi sbu'i gos bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi sbu'i gos bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the garment of a tortoise.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te de'i skyed par byed pa las dang byed pa po gnyis yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te de'i skyed par byed pa las dang byed pa po gnyis yod na ni /
translated: If the agent and action that give rise to it exist,

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyang yod par 'gyur @61a * //üîΩba zhig na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyang yod par 'gyur @61a * // ba zhig na /
translated: then consciousness and so on would also exist.

original: de dag ni med do //
analyzed: de dag ni med do //
translated: But they do not exist.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / byed po yod par gyur pa de //
analyzed: 'di ltar / byed po yod par gyur pa de //
translated: An existent agent

original: las su gyur pa mi byed do //
analyzed: las su gyur pa mi byed do //
translated: does not perform an existent action.üîΩAn existent agent

original: byed po ma yin gyur pa yang //
analyzed: byed po ma yin gyur pa yang //
translated: does not perform a nonexistent action.üîΩA nonexistent agentüîΩdoes not perform a nonexistent action.

original: las su mi 'gyur mi byed do //
analyzed: las su mi 'gyur mi byed do //
translated: He does not perform an action that is not an action.

original: de la byed pas na byed pa po'o //
analyzed: de la byed pas na byed pa po'o //
translated: He is an agent because he acts.

original: cung zad byed pa kho na la byed pa por bsnyad kyi /
analyzed: cung zad byed pa kho na la byed pa por bsnyad kyi /
translated: One is called an agent only if one does something.

original: mi byed pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: mi byed pa ni ma yin la /
translated: One is not called an agent if one does not do something.

original: byed pa de yang byed pa po yin par gyur pa 'am /üîΩma yin par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: byed pa de yang byed pa po yin par gyur pa 'am / ma yin par gyur pa'am /
translated: Moreover, that action is considered to be done by an agent who is

original: yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa zhig la rtog pa zhig go //
analyzed: yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa zhig la rtog pa zhig go //
translated: either existent, or nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent.

original: bya bas na las de byed pa po'i 'dod par gyur pa dam pa'o //
analyzed: bya bas na las de byed pa po'i 'dod par gyur pa dam pa'o //
translated: The action is the object of the agent‚Äôs desire.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is of three kinds:

original: yin par gyur pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa dang / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yin par gyur pa dang / ma yin par gyur pa dang / yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa'o //
translated: existent, nonexistent, and both existent and nonexistent.

original: de la byed pa po yin par gyur pa bya ba dang ldan pa ni las su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la byed pa po yin par gyur pa bya ba dang ldan pa ni las su gyur pa ste /
translated: An existent agent who possesses activity performs an existent action.

original: bya ba dang ldan pa mi byed do zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gcig go //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa mi byed do zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gcig go //
translated: This is the first thesis.

original: de nas byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa bya ba dang bral ba yang las su ma gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de nas byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa bya ba dang bral ba yang las su ma gyur pa ste /
translated: Then, a nonexistent agent who lacks activity does not perform a nonexistent action.üîΩThis is the second thesis.

original: bya ba dang bral ba mi byed do zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gzhan yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang bral ba mi byed do zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gzhan yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who is devoid of action does not act‚Äù is another thesis.

original: de la dang po rab tu sgrub par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de la dang po rab tu sgrub par bzhed nas /
translated: In order to prove the first, he says:

original: bshad pa / yin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: bshad pa / yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: If it exists, there is no action.

original: byed po med pa'i las su'ang 'gyur //
analyzed: byed po med pa'i las su'ang 'gyur //
translated: There would also be an action without an agent.

original: byed pa por brjod pa ni /
analyzed: byed pa por brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression ‚Äúagent‚Äù

original: bya ba ni rgyu can yin pa'i phyir byed do zhes bya ba'i bya ba dang bral ba dang ldan pa yin par gyur pa 'ga' zhig kho nas /
analyzed: bya ba ni rgyu can yin pa'i phyir byed do zhes bya ba'i bya ba dang bral ba dang ldan pa yin par gyur pa 'ga' zhig kho nas /
translated: is used in reference to one who is engaged in action, because action is the cause.üîΩTherefore, one who is engaged in action, who is the cause of action,

original: byed pa po'i brjod pa 'thob par 'gyur te /üîΩde'i phyir bya ba'i rgyu can gyi byed pa po'i brjod pa thob pa rnam pa de lta bu de la ni /
analyzed: byed pa po'i brjod pa 'thob par 'gyur te / de'i phyir bya ba'i rgyu can gyi byed pa po'i brjod pa thob pa rnam pa de lta bu de la ni /
translated: obtains the expression ‚Äúagent.‚Äù

original: gang gis las de byed par 'gyur ba bya ba gzhan med do //
analyzed: gang gis las de byed par 'gyur ba bya ba gzhan med do //
translated: In that case, there is no other action by which that action would be performed.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: When?üîΩüîΩ

original: bya ba med pas byed pa po las mi byed pa de'i tshe byed pa po la ltos pa med cing byed pa po med pa'i las su 'gyur na /
analyzed: bya ba med pas byed pa po las mi byed pa de'i tshe byed pa po la ltos pa med cing byed pa po med pa'i las su 'gyur na /
translated: because there is no action, the agent does not perform an action, then there would be an action that does not depend on an agent and there would be an action without an agent.

original: byed pa po med pa'i las ni srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i las ni srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: An action without an agent is not possible.

original: mo gsham gyi bus bum pa byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bus bum pa byed pa bzhin no //
translated: It would be like the son of a barren woman making a pot.

original: de ltar na re zhig yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa dang / byed pa po med pa'i las su yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa dang / byed pa po med pa'i las su yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, first, the error of the consequence that an existent would be without action and an action would be without an agent would ensue.

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las mi byed do //
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa las mi byed do //
translated: An existent agent does not perform an existent action.

original: da ni las yin par gyur pa yang byed pa pos byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni las yin par gyur pa yang byed pa pos byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that an existent action is not performed by an agent, it is said:

original: yin par gyur pa bya ba med //
analyzed: yin par gyur pa bya ba med //
translated: An existent does not perform an action.

original: las med byed pa por yang 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: las med byed pa por yang 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Without an action, one would become an agent.

original: las yin par gyur pa zhes bya @61b ba ni bya ba dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: las yin par gyur pa zhes bya @61b ba ni bya ba dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: An existent action is one that possesses action.

original: bya ba'i rgyu can gyi las kyi brjod pa thob zin pa de la ni /
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyu can gyi las kyi brjod pa thob zin pa de la ni /
translated: That which has already obtained the expression of an action that is the cause of action,

original: gzod yang gang gis las de byed par 'gyur ba'i bya ba gzhan yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzod yang gang gis las de byed par 'gyur ba'i bya ba gzhan yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: does not exist again as another action that would cause the performance of that action.

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: In that case,

original: re zhig las yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa yin no //üîΩgang gi tshe /
analyzed: re zhig las yin par gyur pa la bya ba med pa yin no // gang gi tshe /
translated: First, that which is an existent action does not exist.üîΩWhen that which is an existent action does not exist,

original: bya ba gzhan med pa de'i tshe ni las yin par gyur pa de byed pa po mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan med pa de'i tshe ni las yin par gyur pa de byed pa po mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: then that which is an existent agent does not perform it.

original: gang gi tshe las la bya ba gnyis pa med pas mi byed pa de'i tshe ni las de'i byed pa po ni las med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe las la bya ba gnyis pa med pas mi byed pa de'i tshe ni las de'i byed pa po ni las med pa ste /
translated: When that which is an existent action does not exist because it does not have a second action, then the agent of that action does not have an action.

original: las mi bdog cing las de mi byed pa kho nar byed pa por 'gyur na /
analyzed: las mi bdog cing las de mi byed pa kho nar byed pa por 'gyur na /
translated: That which is an agent without an action would be an agent even though it does not perform that action.

original: 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin te /üîΩmtshams med pa'i las ma yin pa la ni /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin te / mtshams med pa'i las ma yin pa la ni /
translated: But this is not logical.

original: mtshams med pa'i las kyi byed pa po nyid ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i las kyi byed pa po nyid ma mthong ngo //
translated: For one who is not a perpetrator of a heinous action is not seen to be a perpetrator of a heinous action.

original: de ltar byed pa po yin par gyur pas las yin par gyur pa mi byed do zhes yang dag par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po yin par gyur pas las yin par gyur pa mi byed do zhes yang dag par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having correctly established that that which is an existent agent does not perform that which is an existent action,

original: da ni byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa yang las ma yin par gyur ba ji ltar mi byed pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa yang las ma yin par gyur ba ji ltar mi byed pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate how that which is not an existent agent does not perform that which is not an existent action, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩThat which is not an existent agent does not perform that which is not an existent action.

original: gal te byed por ma gyur na //üîΩlas su ma gyur byed pa ni //
analyzed: gal te byed por ma gyur na // las su ma gyur byed pa ni //
translated: If the agent does not exist,

original: las la rgyu ni med par 'gyur //üîΩbyed pa po yang rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: las la rgyu ni med par 'gyur // byed pa po yang rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: then action would be without a cause.üîΩAnd the agent would be without a cause.üîΩIf the agent does not exist, then action would be without a cause.üîΩAnd the agent would be without a cause.

original: las ma yin par gyur pa ni rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las ma yin par gyur pa ni rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is not an action is without a cause.

original: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa ni gang bya ba dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa ni gang bya ba dang bral ba yin la /
translated: That which is not an agent is that which is devoid of action.

original: bya ba yang byed pa por bsnyad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: bya ba yang byed pa por bsnyad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: And action is the cause of the designation of an agent.

original: bya ba dang bral ba'i byed pa po yang rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba dang bral ba'i byed pa po yang rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the agent devoid of action would be without a cause.

original: rgyu med par smra ba khas len pa yin na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu ril bsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba khas len pa yin na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu ril bsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
translated: If one accepts the doctrine of causelessness, then cause and effect would be completely refuted.üîΩIf there is no cause, then neither

original: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: effect nor cause would be tenable.

original: rgyu khas blangs par gyur na ni gang zhig rgyus bskyed pa de ni 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: rgyu khas blangs par gyur na ni gang zhig rgyus bskyed pa de ni 'bras bu yin la /
translated: If one accepts the doctrine of causality, then that which is produced by a cause is the effect.

original: de'i skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu yin no zhes bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: de'i skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu yin no zhes bya bar rigs te /
translated: And that which produces it is the cause.

original: dper na bum pa'i rgyu ni 'jim pa yin la /
analyzed: dper na bum pa'i rgyu ni 'jim pa yin la /
translated: For example, the cause of a pot is clay.

original: bum pa 'bras bu yin zhing 'khor lo la sogs pa de'i byed rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa 'bras bu yin zhing 'khor lo la sogs pa de'i byed rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
translated: The pot is the effect, and the potter, wheel, and so on are its active causes.

original: rgyu med par smra ba khas blangs na ni rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba khas blangs na ni rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: If you accept that things arise without a cause, then because they would not depend on causes,

original: nam mkha'i me tog ltar bum pa med la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog ltar bum pa med la /
translated: like a sky flower, a pot would not exist.

original: bum pa med na de'i byed rgyu yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: bum pa med na de'i byed rgyu yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: And if a pot does not exist, how could its active causes exist?üîΩThus, if there is no cause,

original: de ltar na rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // rgyu yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then an effect and a cause are untenable.üîΩTherefore, if that does not exist,

original: de'i phyir / de med na ni bya ba dang // byed pa po dang bya mi rigs //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de med na ni bya ba dang // byed pa po dang bya mi rigs //
translated: then an action, an agent, and a patient are illogical.

original: de med na ste /üîΩ'bras bu dang rgyu med na ci zhig byed pa @62a * //üîΩla bya ba yod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de med na ste / 'bras bu dang rgyu med na ci zhig byed pa @62a * // la bya ba yod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If that does not exist,üîΩthen with respect to what would an action exist?

original: bya ba gang zhig la rdza mkhan rang dbang du gyur pas byed pa po nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: bya ba gang zhig la rdza mkhan rang dbang du gyur pas byed pa po nyid du 'gyur /
translated: With respect to what action would a potter become an agent through becoming independent?

original: 'jim pa dag kyang de'i bdag nyid kyis nye bar gyur pa las sgrub par byed pa dam pa nyid yin pa'i sgo nas byed par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jim pa dag kyang de'i bdag nyid kyis nye bar gyur pa las sgrub par byed pa dam pa nyid yin pa'i sgo nas byed par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, it is not logical that the clay, by way of its own nature, is the primary creator of the pot, by way of being the creator.üîΩThus, first:üîΩIf it does not exist, then action,

original: de ltar na re zhig / de med na ni bya ba dang // byed pa po dang byed mi rigs //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig / de med na ni bya ba dang // byed pa po dang byed mi rigs //
translated: The agent, and the instrument are illogical.

original: zhes bya'o // de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore:

original: bya ba la sogs mi rigs na //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs mi rigs na //
translated: If action and so on are illogical,

original: chos dang chos min yod ma yin //
analyzed: chos dang chos min yod ma yin //
translated: Virtue and vice do not exist.

original: 'di ltar lha sbyin srog gcod pa spong ba'i bya ba la rang dbang du gyur pa las byed pa por gyur nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha sbyin srog gcod pa spong ba'i bya ba la rang dbang du gyur pa las byed pa por gyur nas /
translated: Thus, when Devadatta, having become independent with regard to the action of abandoning killing, becomes the agent,

original: las byed par gyur pa'i sgo nas srog gcod pa spong ba'i bya ba byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: las byed par gyur pa'i sgo nas srog gcod pa spong ba'i bya ba byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: by way of becoming the agent of the action, he performs the action of abandoning killing.

original: de la chos nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la chos nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, virtue arises in him.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i las kyi lam dge ba'i bya bas bsgrub par bya ba bcu char dang / dge ba'i chos kyi rtsom pa dkon mchog gsum dang / pha dang / ma dang / de las gzhan mchod par 'os pa mchod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i las kyi lam dge ba'i bya bas bsgrub par bya ba bcu char dang / dge ba'i chos kyi rtsom pa dkon mchog gsum dang / pha dang / ma dang / de las gzhan mchod par 'os pa mchod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the ten virtuous karmic paths are established by virtuous action, and the virtuous dharmas that are the basis of composition, such as the three jewels, father, mother, and those worthy of worship, and so on, should be applied to them.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa rnams med na chos ma yin pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can la yang med par thal bar 'gyur ba las bzlog ste brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa po dang byed pa rnams med na chos ma yin pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can la yang med par thal bar 'gyur ba las bzlog ste brjod par bya'o //
translated: if action, agent, and instrument do not exist, then it follows that non-Dharma, such as killing, and so on, would not exist.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: When it is like that,

original: de ltar chos dang chos ma yin pa med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar chos dang chos ma yin pa med pa de'i tshe /
translated: then at that time, since Dharma and non-Dharma do not exist,üîΩthe result of those two also does not exist.

original: de'i 'bras bu yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To explain that, it is said:

original: chos dang chos min med na ni //
analyzed: chos dang chos min med na ni //
translated: If Dharma and non-Dharma do not exist,

original: de las byung ba'i 'bras bu med //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'bras bu med //
translated: then the result arising from them does not exist.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa gnyis med na ni /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa gnyis med na ni /
translated: If both Dharma and non-Dharma do not exist,

original: chos dang chos ma yin pas bskyed pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pas bskyed pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And there would be no desired or undesired effects produced by virtue and nonvirtue.üîΩTherefore, if there is no effect,

original: de'i phyir / 'bras bu med na thar pa dang // mtho ris 'gyur ba'i lam mi 'thad //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'bras bu med na thar pa dang // mtho ris 'gyur ba'i lam mi 'thad //
translated: The path to liberation and higher rebirth is untenable.

original: gal te 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid can bde 'gro yod par gyur na ni de'i tshe de'i don du 'jig rten pa'i lam bsgom pa mdzes par 'gyur la /üîΩgal te de yang 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa thar pa'i mtshan nyid can yod na yang de'i don du /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid can bde 'gro yod par gyur na ni de'i tshe de'i don du 'jig rten pa'i lam bsgom pa mdzes par 'gyur la / gal te de yang 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa thar pa'i mtshan nyid can yod na yang de'i don du /
translated: If there were a happy rebirth characterized by the meditative concentration and formless absorptions that are the effect of the worldly path, then it would be beautiful to cultivate the worldly path for the sake of that.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: And if there were the effect of that, nirvana characterized by liberation, then it would be tenable to cultivate the noble eightfold path that transcends the world for the sake of that.

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when there is no effect,

original: 'bras bu med @62b na thar pa dang // mtho ris 'gyur ba'i lam mi 'thad //
analyzed: 'bras bu med @62b na thar pa dang // mtho ris 'gyur ba'i lam mi 'thad //
translated: the path to liberation and higher rebirth is untenable.

original: gzhan yang / de ltar 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de ltar 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: Moreover, if there is no effect,

original: bya ba dag ni thams cad kyang //
analyzed: bya ba dag ni thams cad kyang //
translated: All actions are also like that.üîΩ

original: don med nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: don med nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: All actions would be pointless.

original: zhing las dang / tshong spogs dang / gla bkol gyi bya ba la sogs pa gang dag 'bras bu'i don du rtsom pa de dag thams cad kyang 'bras bu med na mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhing las dang / tshong spogs dang / gla bkol gyi bya ba la sogs pa gang dag 'bras bu'i don du rtsom pa de dag thams cad kyang 'bras bu med na mi 'thad do //
translated: All actions such as farming, commerce, and service that are undertaken for the sake of results would be pointless if there were no results.

original: de'i phyir de ltar /üîΩbya ba dag ni thams cad kyang //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar / bya ba dag ni thams cad kyang //
translated: Therefore, in this way,

original: don med nyid du thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: don med nyid du thal bar 'gyur /
translated: All actions would be pointless.

original: 'di dag ni don med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni don med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But they are not pointless.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa ma lus pa'i 'byung khungs su gyur pa mtho ris dang byang grol la skur pa 'debs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa ma lus pa'i 'byung khungs su gyur pa mtho ris dang byang grol la skur pa 'debs pa /
translated: Therefore, this position that a non-existent agent performs a non-existent action is the worst of all, because it is the source of all faults, it deprecates heaven and liberation,

original: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i g-yang sa chen po'i rgyu mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i rgyu'i dngos po dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir /üîΩbyed pa po yin par ma gyur pa las su ma gyur pa byed do zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di ni tha chad kho na yin no //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i g-yang sa chen po'i rgyu mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i rgyu'i dngos po dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir /üîΩbyed pa po yin par ma gyur pa las su ma gyur pa byed do zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di ni tha chad kho na yin no //
translated: and it is the cause of the great abyss of the hells and so on, because it contradicts the cause of what is seen and unseen.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dam bca' ba gnyis yang dag par bsgrubs nas /üîΩde ni byed pa po gnyi ga'i ngo bo las gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang mi byed do zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dam bca' ba gnyis yang dag par bsgrubs nas / de ni byed pa po gnyi ga'i ngo bo las gnyi ga'i ngo bo yang mi byed do zhes bshad pa /
translated: Thus, having correctly established these two theses,

original: byed pa por gyur ma gyur pa //
analyzed: byed pa por gyur ma gyur pa //
translated: now, in order to explain that the agent does not perform the action of both kinds with respect to both kinds of object, he says:üîΩThe existent and non-existent

original: gyur ma gyur de mi byed de //
analyzed: gyur ma gyur de mi byed de //
translated: agent does not performüîΩthe existent and non-existent action.

original: las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa bya ba dang ldan pa dang / bya ba dang mi ldan pa gang yin pa de ni byed pa po yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pas mi byed do //
analyzed: las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa bya ba dang ldan pa dang / bya ba dang mi ldan pa gang yin pa de ni byed pa po yin pa dang / ma yin par gyur pas mi byed do //
translated: The existent and non-existent action that is related to activity and not related to activity is not performed by the existent and non-existent agent.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: yin dang ma yin gyur cig la //
analyzed: yin dang ma yin gyur cig la //
translated: Because the existent and non-existent

original: phan tshun 'gal bas ga la yod //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bas ga la yod //
translated: are mutually contradictory.

original: dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu bya ba dang ldan pa yang yin la bya ba dang mi ldan pa yang yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la dus gcig tu bya ba dang ldan pa yang yin la bya ba dang mi ldan pa yang yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: It is not logical that a single entity is related to activity and not related to activity at the same time.

original: de'i phyir / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir / byed pa po yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa yang las yin pa dang ma yin par gyur pa mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, the existent and non-existent agent does not perform the existent and non-existent action.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: de ltar phyogs mthun pa la skyon brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs mthun pa la skyon brjod nas /
translated: Having thus stated the error in the case of the similar,

original: phyogs mi mthun pa la yang bsal bar bzhed nas bshad pa /üîΩbyed pa por ni gyur pa yis //üîΩma gyur las ni mi byed de //
analyzed: phyogs mi mthun pa la yang bsal bar bzhed nas bshad pa / byed pa por ni gyur pa yis // ma gyur las ni mi byed de //
translated: in order to show the error in the case of the dissimilar, he says:üîΩThe existentüîΩdoes not perform the non-existent action.

original: ma gyur pas kyang gyur mi byed //
analyzed: ma gyur pas kyang gyur mi byed //
translated: The non-existent does not perform the existent action.

original: re zhig byed pa po yin par gyur pa bya ba dang ldan pas ni las su ma gyur ba bya ba dang mi ldan pa mi byed de /
analyzed: re zhig byed pa po yin par gyur pa bya ba dang ldan pas ni las su ma gyur ba bya ba dang mi ldan pa mi byed de /
translated: First, the existent agent, who possesses activity, does not perform the non-existent action, which lacks activity,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: 'dir yang skyon der thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang skyon der thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the same error would ensue here.

original: yin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: The existent would be without activity.

original: byed po med pa'i las su'ang @63a * //
analyzed: byed po med pa'i las su'ang @63a * //
translated: And there would be an action without an agent.

original: 'gyur // zhes bya bas de ltar byed pa po yin par gyur pas las mi byed do //
analyzed: 'gyur // zhes bya bas de ltar byed pa po yin par gyur pas las mi byed do //
translated: Thus, the existent agent does not perform the action.

original: las yin par ma gyur pa'ang byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: las yin par ma gyur pa'ang byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The non-existent agent also does not perform the action.

original: las yin par ma gyur pa ni rgyu med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: las yin par ma gyur pa ni rgyu med par 'gyur la /
translated: The non-existent action would be without a cause.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon thams cad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon thams cad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if there is no cause, all errors would ensue, such as ‚Äúthe effect does not exist.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir phyogs mi mthun pa ni sngar bshad zin pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis sun phyung ba'i phyir yang gtan tshigs dgod par mi bya'o //üîΩbyed pa po yin par gyur pas las yin par ma gyur pa mi byed do zhes bya ba ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du bshad zin pa'i 'don pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa bya ba dang mi ldan pas las yin
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs mi mthun pa ni sngar bshad zin pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis sun phyung ba'i phyir yang gtan tshigs dgod par mi bya'o // byed pa po yin par gyur pas las yin par ma gyur pa mi byed do zhes bya ba ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du bshad zin pa'i 'don pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa bya ba dang mi ldan pas las yin
translated: Therefore, since the dissimilar position has been refuted by the previously explained arguments, it is not necessary to state arguments.

original: par gyur pa mi byed do zhes bya ba yang rnam par bshad par bya'o //üîΩde ltar re zhig / phyogs mi mthun pa la tshig re re dpyad pa'i sgo nas skyon brjod nas /üîΩda ni tshig re re la tshig gnyis gnyis dpyad nas /
analyzed: par gyur pa mi byed do zhes bya ba yang rnam par bshad par bya'o // de ltar re zhig / phyogs mi mthun pa la tshig re re dpyad pa'i sgo nas skyon brjod nas / da ni tshig re re la tshig gnyis gnyis dpyad nas /
translated: Just as it was explained that ‚Äúthe existent agent does not perform the non-existent action,‚Äù so too, following the order of the text, it should be explained that ‚Äúthe non-existent agent, devoid of action, does not perform the existent action.‚ÄùüîΩThus, having in this way stated the errors by analyzing each word of the dissimilar position,

original: skyon brjod par bzhed nas bshad pa /
analyzed: skyon brjod par bzhed nas bshad pa /
translated: now, wishing to state the errors by analyzing each word in pairs of words, he explains:

original: byed pa por ni gyur pa dang // bcas pa las ni ma gyur dang // gyur ma gyur pa mi byed de //
analyzed: byed pa por ni gyur pa dang // bcas pa las ni ma gyur dang // gyur ma gyur pa mi byed de //
translated: The existent and non-existent are not produced by the existent and non-existent agent.

original: gtan tshigs gong du bstan phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gong du bstan phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason has been stated above.

original: byed pa por gyur pa dang bcas pa de ni las yin par ma gyur pa dang / yin par gyur pa dang yin par ma gyur pa mi byed do //
analyzed: byed pa por gyur pa dang bcas pa de ni las yin par ma gyur pa dang / yin par gyur pa dang yin par ma gyur pa mi byed do //
translated: The existent and non-existent action is not produced by the existent and non-existent agent.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gtan tshigs gong du bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gong du bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Because the reason has been stated above.üîΩTherein,

original: de la / yin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: de la / yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: The existent has no activity.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas byed pa por gyur pa dang bcas pas ni mi byed do //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas byed pa por gyur pa dang bcas pas ni mi byed do //
translated: And so on. The existent and non-existent action is not produced by the existent and non-existent agent.

original: las su ma gyur pa yang mi byed de /
analyzed: las su ma gyur pa yang mi byed de /
translated: The non-existent action is not produced.üîΩBecause the error has been stated,

original: las la rgyu ni med par 'gyur //üîΩrgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyon bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las la rgyu ni med par 'gyur // rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyon bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect would be without a cause.üîΩIf there is no cause, there is no effect.

original: las su gyur pa dang ma gyur pa yang mi byed de /
analyzed: las su gyur pa dang ma gyur pa yang mi byed de /
translated: And so on. The existent and non-existent action is not produced by the existent and non-existent agent.

original: yin dang ma yin gyur cig la //
analyzed: yin dang ma yin gyur cig la //
translated: The existent and non-existent are not produced.

original: phan tshun 'gal bas ga la yod //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bas ga la yod //
translated: How could they exist, since they are mutually exclusive?

original: ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How could they exist, since they are mutually contradictory?

original: de ltar re zhig byed pa po yin par gyur pas las yin par ma gyur pa dang yin par gyur pa byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig byed pa po yin par gyur pas las yin par ma gyur pa dang yin par gyur pa byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, an existent agent does not perform an existent or non-existent action.

original: da ni byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa yang /
analyzed: da ni byed pa po ma yin par gyur pa yang /
translated: Now, a non-existent agent

original: las su gyur pa dang bcas pa dang gyur pa dang ma gyur pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa /üîΩbyed pa por ni ma gyur pas //
analyzed: las su gyur pa dang bcas pa dang gyur pa dang ma gyur pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa / byed pa por ni ma gyur pas //
translated: does not perform an action that is existent or non-existent.üîΩAn existent agent does not perform

original: las ni gyur dang bcas pa dang // ma gyur gyur pa mi byed de //
analyzed: las ni gyur dang bcas pa dang // ma gyur gyur pa mi byed de //
translated: an existent or non-existent action.

original: gtan tshigs gong du bstan phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gong du bstan phyir ro //
translated: The reason has been stated above.

original: byed pa po yin par ma @63b gyur pa ni rgyu med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: byed pa po yin par ma @63b gyur pa ni rgyu med par 'gyur la /
translated: An existent agent would be causeless,

original: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa bshad zin pa'i phyir /üîΩbyed pa por ma gyur pa ni mi byed pa yin no //üîΩlas su gyur pa dang bcas pa yang mi byed de /
analyzed: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa bshad zin pa'i phyir / byed pa por ma gyur pa ni mi byed pa yin no // las su gyur pa dang bcas pa yang mi byed de /
translated: and if there were no cause, the error would be as explained in the statement, ‚ÄúIf there were no effect, etc.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, an existent agent does not perform an action.üîΩAn existent action also is not performed.

original: yin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: An existent has no activity.

original: las med byed pa por yang 'gyur //
analyzed: las med byed pa por yang 'gyur //
translated: And also the agent would be without action.

original: zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩlas yin par gyur pa dang yin par ma gyur pa yang mi byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // las yin par gyur pa dang yin par ma gyur pa yang mi byed de /
translated: Because that error would ensue.

original: yin dang ma yin gyur cig la //üîΩphan tshun 'gal bas ga la yod //
analyzed: yin dang ma yin gyur cig la // phan tshun 'gal bas ga la yod //
translated: Nor does the one who is and is not an existent perform the one who is and is not an existent.

original: ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has been explained:

original: da ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa dang / yin par ma gyur pa nyid kyang gnyi ga'i ngo bo yin pa na /
analyzed: da ni byed pa po yin par gyur pa dang / yin par ma gyur pa nyid kyang gnyi ga'i ngo bo yin pa na /
translated: How could that which is and is notüîΩBe one, since they are mutually exclusive?

original: las yin par gyur pa dang ma yin par gyur pa gang yang rung ba ji ltar mi byed pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩbyed pa por gyur ma gyur ni //üîΩlas su gyur dang ma gyur pa //
analyzed: las yin par gyur pa dang ma yin par gyur pa gang yang rung ba ji ltar mi byed pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / byed pa por gyur ma gyur ni // las su gyur dang ma gyur pa //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate how the one who is and is not an agent does not perform the one who is and is not an action, it is said:üîΩThe one who is and is not an agentüîΩDoes not perform the one who is and is not an action.

original: mi byed 'di yang gtan tshigs ni //
analyzed: mi byed 'di yang gtan tshigs ni //
translated: This reason

original: gong du bstan pas shes par bya //
analyzed: gong du bstan pas shes par bya //
translated: Should be understood through the previous explanation.

original: byed pa po yin par gyur pa dang / ma yin par gyur ba ni mi byed de /üîΩyin dang ma yin gyur cig la //
analyzed: byed pa po yin par gyur pa dang / ma yin par gyur ba ni mi byed de / yin dang ma yin gyur cig la //
translated: The one who is and is not an agent does not perform the one who is and is not an action.üîΩBecause it has been explained:üîΩHow could that which is and is not

original: phan tshun 'gal bas ga la yod //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bas ga la yod //
translated: Be one, since they are mutually exclusive?

original: ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlas su gyur pa yang mi byed de //üîΩyin par gyur la bya ba med //
analyzed: ces bshad pa'i phyir ro // las su gyur pa yang mi byed de // yin par gyur la bya ba med //
translated: Because it is said,üîΩAn existent does not perform an action.

original: las med byed pa por yang 'gyur //
analyzed: las med byed pa por yang 'gyur //
translated: And an existent does not perform an action.

original: zhes bya bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows thatüîΩAn existent would be without action.

original: las su ma gyur pa rgyu med pa yang mi byed de /
analyzed: las su ma gyur pa rgyu med pa yang mi byed de /
translated: And an unrealized action, which is without a cause, is not performed,

original: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyon bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med na ni 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyon bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error has already been explained, ‚ÄúIf there is no cause, there is no effect, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir / de ltar phyogs mthun pa dang phyogs mi mthun pa dag la byed pa po dang las su grub pa rnam pa thams cad du rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin can dag ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ltar phyogs mthun pa dang phyogs mi mthun pa dag la byed pa po dang las su grub pa rnam pa thams cad du rigs pa ma yin no // de'i phyir rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin can dag ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, in terms of both the similar and the dissimilar, it is completely illogical for the agent and action to be established.

original: de'i rgyu las dang byed pa po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de ni mi rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las dang byed pa po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de ni mi rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say, ‚ÄúConsciousness and so on, which are characterized by being produced, exist because their causes, action and the agent, exist.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: dngos po rnams med do zhes bya ba 'di ci khyod kyis nges par bzung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams med do zhes bya ba 'di ci khyod kyis nges par bzung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Do you definitely assert that things do not exist?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, we do not.

original: dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba khyod la ni dngos po dang bral ba las thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa srid kyi /
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba khyod la ni dngos po dang bral ba las thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa srid kyi /
translated: For you who propound that things have essence, it is possible that you would repudiate everything because of being separated from things.

original: kho bo cag gis ni brten nas skyes pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid nye bar mi dmigs te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni brten nas skyes pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid nye bar mi dmigs te /
translated: But we do not observe any essence in any thing because things arise dependently.

original: des na gang zhig la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur /üîΩji skad @64a * //
analyzed: des na gang zhig la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur / ji skad @64a * //
translated: So, what is it that you would repudiate?

original: du rin po che'i phreng ba las //
analyzed: du rin po che'i phreng ba las //
translated: As it is said in the Ratnavali:

original: smig rgyu la ni 'di chu zhes //
analyzed: smig rgyu la ni 'di chu zhes //
translated: Thinking that a mirage is water,

original: bsams te der ni song ba las //üîΩgal te chu de med do zhes //
analyzed: bsams te der ni song ba las // gal te chu de med do zhes //
translated: one may approach it,üîΩbut if one apprehends that there is no water there,

original: 'dzin pa de ni blun pa nyid //
analyzed: 'dzin pa de ni blun pa nyid //
translated: that is just foolishness.

original: de bzhin smig rgyu chu lta bu'i //
analyzed: de bzhin smig rgyu chu lta bu'i //
translated: In the same way, the world is like a mirage,

original: 'jig rten yod ce'am med pa zhes //üîΩ'dzin pa de ni rmongs pa ste//
analyzed: 'jig rten yod ce'am med pa zhes // 'dzin pa de ni rmongs pa ste//
translated: and to apprehend it as existent or nonexistentüîΩis just confusion,

original: rmongs pa yod na mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: rmongs pa yod na mi 'grol lo //
translated: and if there is confusion, there is no liberation.

original: mi shes pa las sngar brtags shing //
analyzed: mi shes pa las sngar brtags shing //
translated: One should first investigate non-knowledge,

original: phyi nas de nyid don nges na //üîΩgang tshe dngos po mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: phyi nas de nyid don nges na // gang tshe dngos po mi dmigs pa //
translated: If one ascertains the meaning of reality later,üîΩthen when a thing is not observed,

original: de tshe dngos med ga la 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de tshe dngos med ga la 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: how could a nonthing be?

original: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams la ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa 'grub pa ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams la ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa 'grub pa ga la yod /
translated: Thus, how could the aspects mentioned be established for things that lack intrinsic reality?

original: de'i phyir / dngos po kun rdzob pa smig rgyu'i chu dang mtshungs pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i phyin ci log khas blangs nas rkyen de nyid 'di pa tsam du khas blangs pa kho nas grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos po kun rdzob pa smig rgyu'i chu dang mtshungs pa rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i phyin ci log khas blangs nas rkyen de nyid 'di pa tsam du khas blangs pa kho nas grub pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, all things, which are like a mirage, are established only by accepting the mere conditionality of this and that in the world, accepting the error of the world.

original: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa /üîΩbyed po las la brten byas shing //üîΩlas kyang byed po de nyid la //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa / byed po las la brten byas shing // las kyang byed po de nyid la //
translated: They are not established by any other means.üîΩThis is explained in the following:üîΩThe agent depends on the action,üîΩand the action depends on the agent.

original: brten nas 'byung ba ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ba ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from this

original: grub pa'i rgyu ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: grub pa'i rgyu ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: no cause of establishment is seen.

original: 'dir ni byed cing las la ltos pa med pa ni byed pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ni byed cing las la ltos pa med pa ni byed pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, that which does not depend on the action is not an agent.

original: byed pa po'i byed pa po nyid ni las la ltos nas yin zhing /
analyzed: byed pa po'i byed pa po nyid ni las la ltos nas yin zhing /
translated: The agent of the agent depends on the object.

original: byed pa pos byed bzhin pa ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang las nyid du mi 'gyur bas byed bzhin pa nyid las su brjod pa'i phyir las kyang byed pa po de nyid la brten nas byung ba yin no //
analyzed: byed pa pos byed bzhin pa ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang las nyid du mi 'gyur bas byed bzhin pa nyid las su brjod pa'i phyir las kyang byed pa po de nyid la brten nas byung ba yin no //
translated: And since that which is not being acted upon by an agent would not be an object, the object also occurs in dependence on the agent, since that being acted upon is called the object.

original: de ltar las dang byed pa po dag phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa las ma gtogs par grub pa'i rgyu gzhan ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar las dang byed pa po dag phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa las ma gtogs par grub pa'i rgyu gzhan ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, apart from the establishment of action and agent in mutual dependence, no other cause of their establishment is seen.üîΩJust as action and agent are established in mutual dependence, so too are all other things.

original: ji ltar las dang byed pa po gnyis phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa yin pa de bzhin du dngos po gzhan rnams kyang yin no zhes bsgre ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar las dang byed pa po gnyis phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa yin pa de bzhin du dngos po gzhan rnams kyang yin no zhes bsgre ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To illustrate this, it is said:

original: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: So too, understand appropriation.

original: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
translated: Because the object and agent are refuted.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni las dang byed pa po'i tha snyed thal ma thag pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni las dang byed pa po'i tha snyed thal ma thag pa ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúso too‚Äù indicates that the refutation of the conventions of object and agent is similar to the previous refutation.

original: nye bar len pas na nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pas na nye bar len pa ste /
translated: Appropriation is that which appropriates.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni nye bar len pa'i bya ba bstan la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni nye bar len pa'i bya ba bstan la /
translated: Thus this shows the action of appropriating.

original: des kyang rang gi sgrub byed byed pa po dang nye bar len pa po de nye bar blang bar bya ba las 'dzin par byed cing /
analyzed: des kyang rang gi sgrub byed byed pa po dang nye bar len pa po de nye bar blang bar bya ba las 'dzin par byed cing /
translated: And that also shows that the appropriator and the one who performs the action of appropriating are grasped from the appropriated object.

original: nye bar blangs pa dang nye bar len pa po de gnyis kyang las dang byed pa po ltar phan tshun @64b ltos pas grub pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar blangs pa dang nye bar len pa po de gnyis kyang las dang byed pa po ltar phan tshun @64b ltos pas grub pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: And those two, the appropriated and the appropriator, are established through mutual dependence, like action and agent, but not by their own intrinsic reality.

original: yang ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not by their own intrinsic reality?

original: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because action and agent are refuted.

original: bsal ba ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: bsal ba ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: Refuted means rejected.

original: phyir ro'i sgras ni gtan tshigs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ro'i sgras ni gtan tshigs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù indicates the reason.

original: de'i phyir don ni bdag cag gis gtan tshigs gang dag gis las dang byed pa po bsal bar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de dag kho nas nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po'ang bkag par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir don ni bdag cag gis gtan tshigs gang dag gis las dang byed pa po bsal bar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de dag kho nas nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po'ang bkag par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it is tenable to say, ‚ÄúJust by those arguments that we have explained to refute action and agent, you should understand that the appropriated and the appropriator are also refuted.‚Äù

original: las dang byed pa po bkag pas 'di gnyis phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa yin par nges par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: las dang byed pa po bkag pas 'di gnyis phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa yin par nges par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does the refutation of action and agent ascertain that these two are established in mutual dependence,üîΩbut also,

original: gzhan yang / byed pa po dang las dag gis //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byed pa po dang las dag gis //
translated: by the agent and action,

original: dngos po lhag ma shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po lhag ma shes par bya ste /
translated: the remaining things should be understood.

original: shes rab can gyis zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: shes rab can gyis zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The wise should understand this.

original: shes rab can gyis las dang byed pa po dang nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po las tha dad pa'i dngos po gzhan gang dag bskyed bya skyed byed dang / 'gro ba dang 'gro ba po dang / blta bya dang lta byed dang /
analyzed: shes rab can gyis las dang byed pa po dang nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po las tha dad pa'i dngos po gzhan gang dag bskyed bya skyed byed dang / 'gro ba dang 'gro ba po dang / blta bya dang lta byed dang /
translated: The wise should understand that other things that are different from action, agent, the appropriated, and the appropriator, such as the produced and the producer, going and the goer, the seen and the seer,

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dang / 'byung bar bya ba dang 'byung bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du /üîΩyan lag dang yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can dang / tshad ma dang gzhal bya la sogs pa'i dngos po ma lus pa de dag las dang byed pa po'i rnam par dpyad pas ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa bkag ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi dang / 'byung bar bya ba dang 'byung bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du / yan lag dang yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can dang / tshad ma dang gzhal bya la sogs pa'i dngos po ma lus pa de dag las dang byed pa po'i rnam par dpyad pas ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa bkag ste /
translated: The characteristics and the basis of characteristics, the produced and the producer, and likewise,

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i grub pa nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: the parts and the whole, the qualities and the qualified, the valid cognition and the object of comprehension, and so on‚Äîall these things are to be understood as being established only in mutual dependence, and their intrinsic existence is to be refuted through the analysis of action and agent.

original: de dag rnam par dpyad pa yang dbu ma la 'jug pa las nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rnam par dpyad pa yang dbu ma la 'jug pa las nges par bya'o //
translated: This analysis should be understood from the Madhyamakavatara.

original: gal te / dngos po lhag ma shes par bya //
analyzed: gal te / dngos po lhag ma shes par bya //
translated: If it is the case that the remaining things are to be understood in the same way,

original: zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po'i don rtogs zin pa'i phyir yang bkod pa mi rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po'i don rtogs zin pa'i phyir yang bkod pa mi rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then is it not illogical to present the remaining things, since the meaning of the appropriated and the appropriator has already been understood?

original: 'di ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true.

original: 'on kyang rnam par dpyad par bya ba la gtso bor gyur par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par dpyad par bya ba la gtso bor gyur par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: However, in order to understand that the appropriator is primary with respect to that which is to be analyzed,

original: nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po logs shig tu bkod de /
analyzed: nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po logs shig tu bkod de /
translated: the appropriated and the appropriator are set forth separately.

original: 'di ltar rab tu byed pa phyi ma dag tu yang 'di gnyis kho na'i brtag pa phal cher 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu byed pa phyi ma dag tu yang 'di gnyis kho na'i brtag pa phal cher 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in the later chapters, the analysis of these two will occur for the most part.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this reason,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: sems dmyal 'jigs pa nga yis bstan bya ste /
analyzed: sems dmyal 'jigs pa nga yis bstan bya ste /
translated: I teach the fear of the hells

original: @65a * // sems can stong phrag du ma skyo byas kyang //
analyzed: @65a * // sems can stong phrag du ma skyo byas kyang //
translated: to cause the sadness of many thousands of sentient beings.

original: gang dag shi 'phos ngan song drag 'gro ba'i //
analyzed: gang dag shi 'phos ngan song drag 'gro ba'i //
translated: But those who die and go to the lower miserable realms

original: 'gro ba de dag nam yang yod ma yin //üîΩgang dag ral gri mda' chen mtshon 'byin pa'i //
analyzed: 'gro ba de dag nam yang yod ma yin // gang dag ral gri mda' chen mtshon 'byin pa'i //
translated: never existed.üîΩThe agents of harm that emit

original: gnod pa byed pa yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa yod pa ma yin te //
translated: swords, spears, and weapons do not exist.

original: rtog pa'i dbang gis ngan song de dag na //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dbang gis ngan song de dag na //
translated: Through the power of conception, in the lower miserable realms

original: lus la 'bab mthong de na mtshon cha med //
analyzed: lus la 'bab mthong de na mtshon cha med //
translated: the body is seen to be struck, but there are no weapons there.

original: sna tshogs yid dga' me tog kha phye zhing //
analyzed: sna tshogs yid dga' me tog kha phye zhing //
translated: The flowers of various delightful trees bloom

original: gser gyi khang mchog 'bar ba yid 'ong ba //
analyzed: gser gyi khang mchog 'bar ba yid 'ong ba //
translated: The delightful, blazing, golden mansion.

original: 'di na de la 'ang byed po 'ga' med de //
analyzed: 'di na de la 'ang byed po 'ga' med de //
translated: Here, there is no agent whatsoever for them.

original: de dag rtog pa'i dbang gis bzhag pa yin //
analyzed: de dag rtog pa'i dbang gis bzhag pa yin //
translated: They are posited through the power of thought.

original: rtog pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten rnam brtags te //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten rnam brtags te //
translated: The world is imagined through the power of thought.

original: 'du shes 'dzin pas byis pa rnam par phye //
analyzed: 'du shes 'dzin pas byis pa rnam par phye //
translated: The childish are distinguished by the apprehension of discriminations.

original: 'dzin dang 'dzin med de yang 'byung ba min //
analyzed: 'dzin dang 'dzin med de yang 'byung ba min //
translated: That apprehension and nonapprehension do not arise.

original: yongs su rtog pa sgyu ma smig rgyu bzhin //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa sgyu ma smig rgyu bzhin //
translated: Imagination is like an illusion or a mirage.üîΩThis is the commentary on the eighth chapter, having eight verses, calledüîΩ‚Äúthe examination of action and agent.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs so //üîΩslob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba tshig gsal ba las /üîΩlas dang byed pa po brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa brgyad pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhal snga nas sbyar ba tshig gsal ba las / las dang byed pa po brtag pa zhes bya ba rab tu byed pa brgyad pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: // /'dir / de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
analyzed: // /'dir / de bzhin nyer len shes par bya //
translated: The appropriator should be understood in the same way,

original: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang byed po bsal phyir ro //
translated: Because the object and agent are refuted.

original: zhes gang smras pa de ni mi rigs te //
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de ni mi rigs te //
translated: That is not correct.üîΩBecause:

original: 'di ltar / lta dang nyen la sogs pa dang / tshor sogs dang yang dbang byas pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lta dang nyen la sogs pa dang / tshor sogs dang yang dbang byas pa //
translated: Seeing, hearing, and so on, and also feeling and so on, are controlled.

original: gang gi yin pa de dag gi / snga rol de yod kha cig smra //
analyzed: gang gi yin pa de dag gi / snga rol de yod kha cig smra //
translated: Some say that prior to each of these,üîΩthe appropriator exists.

original: lta ba dang nyan pa dang snom pa dang myang ba la sogs pa rnams dang / tshor ba dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams nye bar len pa po gang gis nye bar len pa yin pa'i nye bar len pa po de ni nye bar len pa de dag gi snga rol na yod do zhes mang pos bkur ba
analyzed: lta ba dang nyan pa dang snom pa dang myang ba la sogs pa rnams dang / tshor ba dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams nye bar len pa po gang gis nye bar len pa yin pa'i nye bar len pa po de ni nye bar len pa de dag gi snga rol na yod do zhes mang pos bkur ba
translated: Some say that prior to each of the appropriated aggregates, the appropriator exists.
